Murad Skincare has a 30-year legacy of developing clinically proven products that are backed by science and cruelty-free. Founded by dermatologist Dr. Howard Murad, we follow four pillars of wellness to create products and experiences for happier lives: Eat your water, be kind to your mind, nourish your skin, and awaken your body. We’re proud to be part of the Unilever prestige family that works every day towards enhancing sustainability and inclusivity. We stand against discrimination and hate, and actively advocate for inclusion: so much so that one of our core values is respect, connect, and appreciate. Our team members are as diverse as they are talented—each bringing a unique perspective to an environment that encourages coloring outside of the lines, speaking up, and collaboration—and we’re ready for you to join our team!This Digital Designer will support the development of global campaigns, with a focus on all digital/social platforms. With a critical eye and a clean aesthetic, you’ll provide smart typography, color and layout solutions that are aligned with brand guidelines. You’re agile, flexible and collaborative when partnering with cross-functional team members to elevate brand equity, engage consumers and support business objectives. You’re also comfortable executing your own projects from concept to production.ResponsibilitiesIdeate, innovate and design supporting assets for global campaigns, with a focus on cohesive digital/e-commerce campaigns across desktop and mobile, including site banners, landing pages, emails and paid mediaConceptualize and produce social content (still posts, GIFs, Instagram stories, etc.) as needed, including shooting, retouching and guiding external agencies/creatorsClosely collaborate with social team to plan content calendars, with an eye toward maintaining key metrics, and contribute to brainstorms to help surface new, innovative ways to create content and engage the brand’s fans/followersMaintain elevated look/feel and consistency, while partnering with cross-functional teams on understanding costs for the most impactful designs within budgetProvide general design support on ancillary print projects such direct mail pieces and unexpected packaging opportunities, as neededExecute production on all owned projects from setting up mechanicals to attending press checks, as neededSupport in conceptualizing campaign visuals, as neededPartner with other creative team members during deadline crunches to complete high-profile priority projectsVoraciously consume digital/social content to help the brand stay ahead of competitionRequirements/Qualifications 3+ years graphic design experience with undergraduate degree in design-related field Extreme attention to detail, including top-notch organizing and multitasking skills to meet tight deadlines, handle multiple projects and prioritize accordingly Highly collaborative with excellent work ethic to produce deliverables with speed and humility in a fast-paced environment Strong communication skills, including ability to empathize with vastly different cross-functional teams from sales to marketing Mastery of Adobe CS5+ Photoshop, Illustrator and In Design required; basic Microsoft Office application knowledge Fashion, beauty or media/entertainment background a plusWhat We OfferUnlimited Paid Time OffMedical, Dental, Vision InsuranceFSA/HSALife/Accident InsuranceEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Professional Development Resources401(k) Employer Match ProgramThis position is based in our El Segundo, CA headquarters, which is currently 40% hybrid onsite/remote work.The expected base salary for this position is $70,000 to $80,000. The exact base salary is determined by various factors including experience, skills, education, geographic location, and budget. In addition to base salary, Murad offers a competitive benefits package to eligible employees, including medical insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, life insurance, accident insurance, critical illness insurance, disability insurance, retirement savings plans and company match, paid family leave, education-related programs, paid holidays, discretionary vacation time, and more.Murad is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Murad is an equal opportunity employer; committed to creating a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Twelve South is a Charleston-based company that designs and sells branded accessories for consumer electronics, computers, and mobile devices, including Apple. Our products are sold worldwide in Apple Store, Amazon, Best Buy, and TwelveSouth.com.  We are seeking an Inventory Control Analyst who will contribute to the overall success and development of the company’s supply chain. We are looking for someone who loves developing and implementing processes for inventory control. We need someone who is meticulous and loves being proud of their work.The unique position requires an individual who possesses a positive attitude, strong organizational skills, attention to detail, the ability to multitask, communicate effectively both verbally and written, and is eager to learn!What You'll Do:  Lead company efforts in developing and implementing inventory management policies and procedures.Develop and implement systemic reconciliation processes between ERP and warehouse management systems.Create reports and provide insights to the management team on inventory accuracy.Identify and resolve inventory discrepancies or issues, conduct regular inventory audits, and implement strategies to improve inventory accuracy.Implement and oversee cycle count and physical inventory programs across in-house and third-party warehouses.Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including finance, production, fulfillment, and logistics, to drive inventory accuracy.Partner with Accounting and Fulfillment teams to ensure timely and accurate month-end close. Produce compliance reports for timely correction of variances.The Must-Haves: 2-5 years experience with a strong understanding of inventory control principles and best practices.Familiarity with and/or willingness to learn Apple OS.Must be highly energetic and a self-starter who excels in detail-oriented processes.Must have killer decision-making, problem-solving, and creative thinking skills.Ability to multitask and prioritize a variety of tasks to meet deadlines.Attention to detail and a passion for data accuracy.Critical thinking and strong analytical skills: ability to collect, prioritize, and analyze data to support demand and supply optimization.Must love working on a team and making decisions as a team playerMust have strong communication skills to be a fantastic liaison between the sales team, warehouses, and distributors.Proficient in Excel

BAY COUNTY CHAMBER OF COMMERCEJob Description POSITION: Director, Marketing and Communications ACCOUNTABLE TO: President/CEO RESPONSIBILITIES:Drive all marketing and communications efforts for the Chamber, including, but not limited to marketing campaigns, website, social media, advertising, graphic design, and project management.Maintain the website including design, function, advertising and content updates.Manage and produce Guide to Membership Opportunities, Membership Decal, Business Plan, news releases, eBiz Newsletter, the Bay County Map and other promotional programs.Develop promotional material for Chamber events.Provide specialized support to all staff for communications and public relations.Coordinate and develop campaigns to promote commerce for Bay County.Develop radio, TV, newspaper and media relations to keep Chamber members and the general public aware of Chamber goals and activities.Keep abreast of special activities and issues going on within the Bay County area.Work with members to develop advertisements and marketing strategiesOversee and manage the outsourcing of Chamber publications including: Bay Biz magazine and the Guide to Discovering Bay County.Sell advertising for Chamber website.Responsible for photography of all Chamber Events.Place enhancements for members on website as needed.Provide staff support and/or manage any special projects as directed by the President/CEO.Handle press relations regarding Chamber activities and be a business resource for all local media.FEMA Emergency Support Function 18 representative during major disasters in Bay County.MINIMUM SKILLS/EDUCATION REQUIREMENT: Skills: Excellent communication and writing skills. Will consider experience for education requirement.Experience: Minimum of two years graphic design, communication or journalism experience required. Website design a plus.

As well as being a part of the Admin Team at our Fort Worth office. This includes but is not limited to meeting logistics and calendar management, budget tracking and reporting, preconstruction billings, and expense reporting. This position also provides general support to the company’s construction projects. Role You Will Play: We are seeking an experienced Project Manager to join our renowned interior design firm, specializing in commercial and multi-family channels across the United States. As the Project Manager, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing a variety of projects throughout the United States at once. You will use your strong experience within commercial construction to continue to help drive this division to new heights! You will help to develop comprehensive project plans that outline the scope, goals, timeline, and budget for each interior design construction project as well as allocate and manage resources effectively, including personnel, materials, and equipment, to ensure the timely completion of projects.Company:A well-established company, renowned for it’s exceptional reputation and remarkable growth trajectory.An organization that values your contributions and empowers you to make a significant impact from day one.Embark on a role that offers the flexibility to leverage your extensive network, driving membership growth, and pioneering strategic initiatives in unexplored territories.Benefits & Features:Experience a work environment where you are embraced as part of a close-knit family, valued for your unique skills and contributions, rather than being reduced to mere numbers on a spreadsheet.Benefit from robust and enticing incentive programs, along with a comprehensive package of strong benefits, designed to reward your dedication and drive.Receive extensive product training and ongoing support, ensuring that you have the knowledge and resources necessary to excel in your role.Community: Chicago, IL, is a dynamic and diverse city known for its world-class cultural attractions, including renowned museums like the Art Institute and vibrant neighborhoods like Wicker Park and Lincoln Park.The city offers a thriving job market, with opportunities in finance, technology, healthcare, and more, making it a hub for career growth and development.Chicago's robust public transportation system, including the iconic "L" train, makes commuting convenient, reducing the need for a car and helping to mitigate traffic congestion.With a lively food scene featuring deep-dish pizza, gourmet hot dogs, and diverse international cuisine, Chicago is a haven for food lovers, offering a taste of culinary excellence from around the world right at your doorstep.

SourceAbled is seeking Transaction Specialists to transcribe confidential information from scanned images of paper documents. The Transaction Specialist combines documents into transactions and processes them through a series of workflow functions. Transaction Specialists maintain the highest level of accuracy and focus on process effectiveness to meet efficiency standards.Note: This is a seasonal position, and the duration may be extended based on project volume. The start date is in April, and the project is expected to last for 4 to 6 weeks.The Data Entry team transcribes confidential information from scanned images of paper documents for our clients. One or multiple documents are combined into transactions and processed through a series of segmented workflow functions.Responsibilities: Preparing work for digitization by extracting payments and documents from mailing envelopes.Inputting and validating data into the system, following standard operating procedures and customer-specific instructions for processing.Operating high-volume document scanning machines while ensuring the quality of scanned images.Validating and reconciling electronic records to paper documentation.Making judgment calls regarding routine duties, with the ability to refer non-routine situations to a supervisor or manager.Willingness to learn new processing functions and equipment operation in all areas/departments of production as needed.Maintaining site productivity and quality standards.Contributing to meeting team accuracy and production goals, in addition to individual targets.Ensuring adherence to all customer and bank guidelines related to operations, internal audit, security, and general practices.Lifting and moving mail trays weighing up to 50 pounds.Requirements:No prior experience needed – training provided.High school diploma or equivalent preferred.Must pass a background check and credit check.Willingness to work in a high-security production environment.Familiarity with the use of a PC, as some functions require this skill.Proficiency with typing and alphanumeric data entry, with excellent accuracy.Team player with the ability to maintain a positive attitude and be flexible to help meet daily processing deliverables.Schedule Options - 1s shift - $18 per hour2nd Shift - $19.80 per hour3rd shift - $20.70 per hour A Government Security Clearance may be required for this position. HireMinds has been engaged by a full-service strategic media management and marketing solutions agency, to find their newest Media Assistant. Their clients range from healthcare, education, finance, retail, technology, travel/tourism, and advocacy. They approach all media projects with an eye to brand integration and implementation that works for each medium – TV, radio, out-of-home, print, and multi-channel digital platforms.The Media Assistant is an integral support member of the Media team. The Media Assistant will work closely with Buyers, Supervisors, and Account Management to ensure that various Video (TV, OTT) and Audio (terrestrial and digital radio, podcast) and Digital (DSP/SEM/Direct Site) campaigns run smoothly. You will organize all stages of the buying process from meeting on initial requests, to carrying out post analysis and reporting requests. The position has a set list of responsibilities daily, but it is common that the Media Assistant would be asked to perform responsibilities ad hoc based on needs.*Please Note: This is a hybrid work environment that will require onsite visibility at their North Andover location 2 days per week*Responsibilities:Campaign liaison to media vendor representatives as well as Administrative Support to members of the Media Buying TeamResponsible for sending broadcast orders and revisions and responding to station/network vendors’ needs in a timely mannerContact media vendors for logs (airing times for TV and Radio advertisements) and pacing reports, and responsible for pre and post log entry and budget trackingHandle traffic requestsHandle credit requests and manage invoice discrepancies with accountingMaintain quality relationships with media vendorsAssist with client reportingAbility to multi-task and work on several campaigns at oncePerform other projects and work assignments, as requested by Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent preferredWell versed in the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel and PowerPointExcellent organizational skillsExperience completing multiple assignments in a very fast-paced work environmentExcellent interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal)Highly dependableSuccessfully adapts to ever changing prioritiesHigh attention to detail and follow throughWorks well under pressureSuccessfully works independently as well as in a team environment

No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from the US/Canada residents during the application process. Support the design of social media content, email campaigns, and digital marketing assets. UI/UX Design Collaborate with senior designers and product teams to produce wireframes, mockups, and prototypes for websites and mobile apps. Help create user-centered designs that align with project goals and user requirements. Contribute to the development of intuitive user experiences by participating in design discussions and ideation sessions. Design Support Assist in maintaining design guidelines and standards to ensure consistency across various projects. Stay updated with design trends, tools, and best practices to enhance your design skills and contribute innovative ideas. QualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent in Graphic Design, UI/UX Design, or a related field. A portfolio showcasing your graphic design and UI/UX skills, including projects and examples. Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, XD), or similar software. Basic understanding of UI/UX principles and a strong desire to learn and grow in this field. Attention to detail and effective communication of design concepts. Ability to work collaboratively in a team, adapt to feedback, and incorporate changes into designs. Strong attention to detail. Organized and reliable. Able and willing to present designs to groups of stakeholders. Preferred SkillsBasic knowledge of HTML/CSS and responsive design principles

column2: Wellness Coordinator II - Health & Wellness (QSS 7585) - REPOST
column6: Welcome to Santa Clara Unified School District! Thank you for your interest in Santa Clara Unified School District. Our employees work together to support graduates who are resilient, future-ready, lifelong learners who think critically, solve problems collaboratively, and are prepared to thrive in a global society. SCUSD’s Adult Portrait embodies eight elements that support our students: World-Leading Professional Student-Centered Lifelong Learner Creative and Critical Thinker Adaptive Forward Thinker The Caring Adult Inclusivity Champion Equity Advocate Empowering Collaborator If you have the skills to support this vision, we invite you to apply to join our team. Santa Clara Unified School District serves over 15,000 TK-12 students, in addition to students in Preschool through Adult School. Neighborhoods in the Cities of Santa Clara, Sunnyvale, San Jose, and Cupertino comprise the District's 56 square-mile area. Santa Clara Unified prides itself on having teachers, classified employees, and administrators who are dedicated, experienced professionals who care about each student's well-being and academic preparation. NONDISCRIMINATION STATEMENT: Santa Clara Unified School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex (including sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression), mental or physical disability, age, religion, height, weight, marital or family status, military status, ancestry, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic. The Title IX Coordinator is Lise Strom, 1889 Lawrence Road, Santa Clara, CA 95051Requirements / QualificationsThe Wellness Coordinator acts as a primary liaison between families and staff and school and community-based service providers. Representative Duties of this position are: provide oversight and coordination of campus-based services and service providers; actively engage families, caregivers, and the community; identify campus resources and gaps in service; triage and connect students and families to appropriate services and provide ongoing case management; provide direct service and/or crisis management when necessary; address school climate and safety needs; support training needs of teachers and school staff in the areas of school climate, safety and health; develop and/or support data collection infrastructure and input data to assist with the data-driven decision making and determinate of program effectiveness; function as a complement to or part of a school’s multidisciplinary team or the equivalent; coordinate linkage of identified students to appropriate services; provide and/or organize professional development and parent education as needed. Education and experience: Master’s Degree in Social Work or Psychology and Licensed LCSW, LMFT, or LPCC. Experience working in schools is preferred. Must have the ability to supervise.Certification (Please attach copy of LCSW, LMFT, or LPCC license)Copy of Transcript (Please attach copy of Master's Degree in Social Work or Psychology or transcript)Comments And Other InformationIncomplete applications and/or those lacking current information may not be considered as eligible candidates

Reach is a nonprofit, accredited university that employs job-embedded learning to help communities grow their own talent. At the undergraduate level, Reach offers adults employed in schools and other workplaces the opportunity to earn a unique bachelor’s degree that embraces work experience as part of the learning process. At the post-baccalaureate level, Reach provides “alternative” certification and degree programs for full-time educators and organizational leaders seeking a more equitable world. Reach seeks to evolve a new era in higher education where a job leads to a degree instead of the other way around.We seek to create a world where effort and skills, not money or connections, determine who gets ahead. Learn more about us at https://www.reach.edu/.The Purpose of this RoleThe Special Assistant is a full-time position reporting directly to the Chief of Staff that provides executive-level administrative support in fulfilling responsibilities to provide overall leadership and administration of the University.Core Job ResponsibilitiesProvide executive and administrative support to the President and Chief of Staff, as well as other members of the President’s CabinetMaintain the president’s schedule - coordination of a complex calendar of appointments, meetings, social engagements, and University and community functionsManage communications, compose letters, and handle confidential matters with discretionServes as event coordinator for events hosted by the President and other internal stakeholdersCoordinates the president's travel arrangements, prepares background materials, and provides supporting documents for travel document preparationPrepare and assemble agenda materials; review and proof documents, records and forms for accuracy, completeness and conformance to applicable rules and regulationsSalary$60,000 - $65,000 annually plus benefits. This position will require approx 25% travel with the President and Chief of Staff. Don’t check off every box in the requirements listed above. Please apply anyway! Studies have shown that marginalized communities - such as women, LGBTQ+, and people of color - are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. Reach University is dedicated to building an inclusive, diverse, equitable, and accessible workplace that fosters a sense of belonging – so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to consider still submitting an application. You may be just the right candidate for this role or another one of our openings!Equal Opportunity EmployerReach University is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. Reach University does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability, parental status, veteran status, or any other protected status under applicable laws. We encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply. If you are a qualified candidate with a disability, please e-mail us at PeopleOps@reach.edu if you require a reasonable accommodation to complete this application.

Communicates and collaborates with physicians and other health team members. Provides and coordinates patient care with other health team members. Monitors patients' responses to interventions and reports outcomes. Administers medications as ordered with appropriate documentation. Level Equity is a private investment firm focused on rapidly growing software and technology-driven businesses. Level provides long-term capital across all transaction types in support of continued growth. The firm was founded in 2009 and has raised $3.0 billion in committed capital across ten funds and co-investment vehicles.As the Vice President, Human Resources and Administration, you will lead Level Equity’s internal human resource function, managing recruiting, payroll, benefits, and periodic reviews for Level’s growing 45-person team. You’ll report to Level’s Chief Operating Officer and will also manage the firm’s team of five Executive and Administrative Assistants.What you’ll do:Lead the internal human resources function at Level, including coordination of all aspects of recruiting, onboarding, training, periodic reviews, and departures.Create, administer, and implement HR policies, procedures, and goals to support the firm’s business.Work with Level’s PEO to ensure smooth functioning of payroll and benefits; be the initial point of contact for Level employees for payroll, benefits, parental leave, and other HR-related questions.Administer and periodically assess Level’s benefits including PTO, 401(k) matching, associate stipends, and family leave policies.Work to foster firm culture, employee engagement, and superior performance across the organization.Drive improvements and efficiencies across the HR function and ensure compliance with legal requirements and that best practices are in place.Work closely with Partners and senior management on the performance review process, employee development and retention, and employee career planning.Work with internal counsel on drafting and reviewing employment, consulting, recruiting, and vendor agreements.Oversight of the employee onboarding and orientation processes, as well as separations and the employee exit process.Directly manage administrative team members to ensure seamless coverage of executive support needs and day-to-day office functionality.  What you need to be successful:8+ years of human resources experience with hands-on experience administering an internal HR program for a similarly sized or larger organization.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Strong knowledge of Federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations.Highly organized and strong project management skills - proven ability to multi-task and juggle multiple projects at the same time.

Talent Acquisition Specialist Pinnacle MEP is looking to add an experienced Talent Acquisition Specialist to our growing team! This individual will assist in filling open positions by conducting full cycle recruiting efforts including sourcing, interviewing, and onboarding. We pride ourselves in our commitment to collaboration and strive to create long term relationships for the teams we support.Essential Functions and Responsibilities:Assist in developing job descriptions and maintaining current job descriptions for both construction field and office positions.Review resumes, prescreen interview candidates, cold call active and passive candidates.Conduct regular follow up meetings with hiring managers and appropriate team members to determine the effectiveness of recruiting plans and implementation.Manage ATS applicants, job board applicants, all pertinent applicant information and interview data in the ATS.Schedule follow up interviews for eligible applicants.Assist in projecting upcoming hiring needs.Work with third-party agencies in coordination of recruitment efforts on an as needed basis.Assist in offers and candidate closing.You are a strong fit for this role if you have skills and abilities in these areas:Ability to prioritize high candidate flow and demand.Strong organizational skills, with a high attention to detail and the ability to keep track of both high-level progress and small details.Knowledge of general principles of recruiting, staffing systems, and tools.Experience with applicant tracking systems and candidate sourcing solutions.Knowledge of employment law.Experience in fast-paced environment, high volume recruitment, skilled in negotiations, and change management.Ability to effectively collaborate with teammates and cross-functional teams at all levels in the organization.Education and Experience:Demonstrated experience recruiting skilled trades, office operations, and finance preferred: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related degree.Minimum three to five years of full cycle recruiting experience.Former experience in construction industry is preferred. This is a full-time WFH position based out of Detroit, Michigan, Indianapolis, Indiana, or Columbus, Ohio full-time Monday to Friday. We offer a competitive salary with a full benefit package. Target start: Spring 2024. A resume is required for consideration.

Crew Member (24010257)DescriptionCULTIVATING A BETTER WORLDFood served fast doesn't have to be a typical fast food experience. Chipotle has always done things differently, both in and out of our restaurants. We're changing the face of fast food, starting conversations, and directly supporting efforts to shift the future of farming and food. We hope you'll join us as we continue to learn, evolve, and shape what comes next on our mission to make better food accessible to everyone.THE OPPORTUNITYAt Chipotle, we've created a better place to eat and work. Many employees start just expecting a paycheck, but end up with a rewarding career. We provide exceptional training and a clear career path - over 80% of our managers were promoted from Crew. We prepare real food by hand every day in our restaurants. No freezers, microwaves or can openers to be found. We welcome experienced restaurant professionals and novices alike. We'll provide the training you need to feel confident working at any station - grill, cashier, prep, salsa and expo. We take pride in our exceptional customer service and it's up to each of our team members to create the friendly atmosphere that our customers expect and enjoy. So, whether you have experience as a dishwasher, cashier, server, host, bartender, cook, prep cook, FOH/BOH or no experience at all, we're always looking for passionate and enthusiastic people to join our team. At Chipotle, you'll join a team that's committed to Cultivating A Better World. If this sounds like something you'd like to be a part of, we'd love to meet you! See more details below and apply today.What's In It For YouTuition assistance (100% coverage for select degrees or up to $5,250/year)Free food (yes, really FREE)Medical, dental, and vision insurancePaid time offHoliday closuresCompetitive compensationFull and part-time opportunitiesOpportunities for advancement (80% of managers started as Crew)What You'll Bring To The TableA friendly, enthusiastic attitudePassion for helping and serving others (both customers and team members)Desire to learn how to cook (a lot)Be at least 16 years oldAbility to communicate in the primary language(s) of the work locationWho We AreChipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE: CMG) is cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients without artificial colors, flavors or preservatives. Chipotle has restaurants in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France and Germany and is the only restaurant company of its size that owns and operates all its restaurants in North America and Europe. With employees passionate about providing a great guest experience, Chipotle is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. Chipotle is committed to making its food more accessible to everyone while continuing to be a brand with a demonstrated purpose as it leads the way in digital, technology and sustainable business practices. For more information or to place an order online, visitChipotle Mexican Grill is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. As a people-first company rooted in values, our purpose extends beyond serving nutritious food using real ingredients. It means hiring world-class individuals and fostering a culture that champions diversity, ensures equity, and celebrates inclusion. All qualified applicants, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply.Qualified applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and/or certain state or local laws. Please contact if you need an accommodation due to a disability to complete an application, job interview, and/or to otherwise participate in the hiring process. This email does not respond to non-accommodations related requests.Primary Location: New Jersey - Rockaway - 1810 - Rockaway Townsquare Mall-(01810)Work Location:1810 - Rockaway Townsquare Mall-(01810)301 Mt Hope AveRockaway 07866By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

column2: AMENDED Revenue Officer - Direct Hire (12-Month Roster)
column6: Help Help DutiesWHAT IS THE SMALL BUSINESS SELF EMPLOYED (SBSE) DIVISION?A description of the business units can be found at: https://www.jobs.irs.gov/about/who/business-divisionsVacancies Will Be Filled In The Following Specialty AreasField Collection OperationsThe following are the duties of this position at the full working level. If this vacancy includes more than one grade and you are selected at a lower grade level, you will have the opportunity to learn to perform these duties and receive training to help you grow in this position.Collects delinquent tax and secures delinquent returns from taxpayers who have not resolved their obligations in response to prior correspondence or other contact. Conducts interviews with taxpayers (and/or their representatives) in different environments such as the business location, residence or office as part of the investigative process of collecting delinquent taxes and securing delinquent tax returns. Taxpayers at this level normally include individuals with relatively large gross income from diversified sources, self employed professionals, medium sized partnerships, corporations involved retail, manufacturing, construction, wholesale, and other businesses as well as smaller businesses with valuable or unusual assets.Provides customer service by respecting and explaining the taxpayer's rights, IRS policies and procedures. Provides instructions, and analyzes issues presented by taxpayers, practitioners and IRS employees. Customer service is based upon learning, interpreting, and applying IRM policies and procedures, regulations, court decisions, state and local laws, and various Titles of the United States Code. Provides instructions, and analyzes issues presented by taxpayers, practitioners and IRS employees. Resolve account discrepancies and responds to taxpayer and practitioner requests.Performs credit and financial analysis of the taxpayer financial records to determine the taxpayer's financial condition and ability to pay outstanding tax obligations and prevent future delinquencies. Analyzes financial information and evaluates assets. Applies expense standards and provides guidance on a wide range of financial alternatives to assist taxpayers in identifying options that could assist in resolving delinquent tax obligations including installment agreements, offers in compromise or suspending collection action. Evaluates and compares taxpayers' financial information to internal and external sources to verify taxpayers' financial condition. The purpose of the analysis is to develop a clear plan of action to resolve the case. For business taxpayers, analyzes financial statements that include balance sheets, income statements and profit and loss statements.Performs financial investigations in situations in which taxpayers are unwilling to be forthcoming concerning assets and sources of income. Searches public records, tax returns, and financial and credit information to locate distrainable assets. Summonses taxpayer records and other financial information from the taxpayer and financial institutions or other third parties. Confers with internal and external advisors, analysts, or attorneys (for example: Counsel or Department of Justice) regarding case development, issue determination, case processing and coordination. Develops a feasible plan of action to resolve the case. Recognizes patterns of delay and other indicators that a taxpayer is not cooperating or attempting to defeat assessment or collection of delinquent tax.Plans and takes appropriate enforcement actions to secure an assessment on past due returns, such as summonsing tax records, referrals to examination or assessing taxes using IRC 6020(b), or prompt, quick and jeopardy assessments. Takes appropriate enforced collection action, such as levies, redemptions, seizures, nominee liens, judicial actions, or fraud investigation. Conducts trust fund recovery penalty investigations: evaluates willfulness, responsibility and authority, and recommends penalty assessments. Prepares affidavits, statements and testimony for court cases, such as summons enforcement, or seizure action. Files and releases Federal tax liens.

Borinquen Medical Centers is based in Miami, FL and is seeking to hire a Full-Time Health Navigator to join our team! The Health Navigator will work closely with the Outreach Coordinator to ensure proper continuation and expansion of HIV and PrEP patient navigation and adherence counseling program at Borinquen Medical Centers (BMC). In addition to primary care services, the navigator will ensure access to behavioral health services including mental health counseling and services, outpatient substance use treatment services, SSPs, and social services including transportation to appointments. The Health Navigator will link with local agencies for assistance with housing, food banks, SNAP, and for inpatient substance abuse services. The Health Navigator is the key liaison for cluster response with the Outreach Specialist and will work directly with patients eligible for Test and Treat and seeking consistent access and coverage for PrEP medications. The Health Navigator will ensure that participating clients receive relevant HIV/STI-related education and services, sexual health information, and navigation to health insurance if eligible. These services will be geared towards persons newly diagnosed with HIV and at-risk for HIV within the Miami-Dade County, including but not limited to cisgender/transgender women who have sex with men, and cisgender/transgender men who have sex with men, and any other persons at-risk for acquiring HIV (High Risk Individuals)The Health Navigator is responsible for ensuring HIV (+) patients are provided access to care, navigate in the continuum of care and ensure they receive their medication and appointments. For those HIV negative clients, he/she will ensure patients to be linked in care for PrEP and retained in care all within our Rapid Access program. Once in care, the health navigator will help to ensure these clients are engaging with the HIV healthcare system to improve their healthcare outcomes and overall quality of life. For those clients receiving PrEP the navigator will encourage and facilitate treatment compliance as well as education encouraging risk reduction practices. Navigator is responsible for assisting in the intake process to the agency of patient choice by gathering documentation and by providing support in order to expedite service delivery.Essential Job ResponsibilitiesCoordination and Linkage:Facilitates a welcome into the agency of patient choice and either provides or facilitates orientation/education regarding the agency and its services.Person in charge to coordinate the continuum of care across the agencyRefers patients for tracking and follow up by the Medication Adherence Case ManagerCoordinates with Outreach Specialist for cluster responses in the communityCoordinates with Medication Adherence Case Manager, Outreach Specialist and the care team to implement activities in the community to educate patients and community members in response to clusters or areas of high prevalence. Provides patient education and Facilitates Rapid Access (Test & Treat) and PrEP treatment.Facilitates registration into BHCC services including but not limited to Rapid Access and PrEP care coordination.Provides navigation services (including case management) on a regular basis (according to schedule) and for up to 12 months.Assist in the continued implementation of PrEP services and appointment scheduling in primary care for PrEP, while also ensuring that uninsured and under-insured PrEP clients receive education about coverage programs.Meet with patients, at least quarterly and/or as needed to assist them in filling out PrEP medication coverage applications and ensure appointments are kept with Medication Adherence Case Manager.Provide individual- and relationship-based HIV and STI counseling primarily within BMC’s Electronic Health Records System (EHRS).Provide education about Post-Exposure Prophylaxis (PEP), and other effective biomedical and prevention interventions; refer and coordinate for primary care to all clients to primary care medical services at BMC or the organization of their choice to further discuss PEP and other preventive care with a medical provider.Coordinate collaborative relationships related to PrEP implementation and service delivery, focusing on agencies located in and around Miami-Dade.Accurately complete all statistical data forms for PrEP, primarily within the Electronic Health Records System, ensuring complete and correct reimbursement for services rendered, when applicableReview and maintain up-to-date and accurate knowledge of emerging scientific research regarding biomedical HIV/STI prevention strategies, including PrEP, PEP and related interventions.Maintain highest level of client confidentiality; follow HIPAA regulations.Attend departmental meetings and trainings.Identifies patients need navigation to get into PrEP careCoordinates client’s appointments (hard linkage) to medical, medical case management, mental health, substance abuse treatment, education, or social service appointments to improve client’s well-being.Contact clients to evaluate medication adherence and follows up at least once a month, including verification and/or reminds them of appointments with other departments or other agencies.Communicates with clients one to three days before a foreseen hurricane/natural disaster according to emergency plan procedure.Health Education And NavigationProvides information and emotional support to patients through shared experiences using encouragement, reinforcement of healthful behaviors and helps to decrease client isolation. Provides emotional and educational support to patients who have mental health, substance abuse and homelessness issues. Serves as mentor regarding interaction with medical providers, helping patients prepare for visits and then debriefing what happened, depending on patient need. Provides educational support to clients to enhance their knowledge and understanding of medication protocols, side effects and adherence. Walks clients through appointments for medical care or other social services in order to ensure that clients have a clear understanding of initial steps that need to be taken to obtain appropriate services and will follow up at least once a month and provide on-going support and guidance. Keeps track of patient’s adherence and data points (as outlined in process) through approved documentation.Educates new clients on the care process and what to expect from the continuum of careParticipates in staff training sessions and other meetings as required by the agency and/or the funding sources. Our team is comprised of five procurement teams responsible for buying materials and services across a range of commodities from components and hardware through complex technical and facilities services. The procurement team manages and facilitates procurement from sourcing through payment to support our business units and corporate entities. The Non-Product procurement team is a high volume, fast paced team that relies heavily on metrics to drive value throughout the end-to-end procurement process. Primary Responsibilities:Review of SOW’s (Statements of Work) Creating Non-Disclosure Agreements and/or Proprietary InformationObtaining proposal/quotation activities Documentation write-up Selecting qualified suppliers and perform due diligence Supplier negotiations (price, schedules and terms & conditions) Post-award management and delivery assurance Significant supplier interaction in collaboration with business and programCoordinates with commodity leads/managers and external suppliers to manage requirements and bring issues to resolution Managing supplier's critical path in support of key program milestones Strategic planning while supporting daily tactical and detailed activities May be required to participate in supplier development activity Engage with Business EXIM, Legal, & Sr. Leaders Required Qualifications:0-2 years of experience in the following:Purchase order management including documentation Excellent time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously Familiarity with the use of SAP procurement software Supplier relationship managementUnderstand how to identify and escalate issues (how and when) Experience with analysis and problem solving Preferred Qualifications:Experience with Government contracts, processes and procedures Negotiation skills (internal, across the businesses; external with suppliers) Experience with automation tools Leadership skills – influence, presence, ability to interface internally and with suppliers Demonstrated knowledge of the integrated supply chain, including strategic procurement Ability to effectively interface with senior management on major matters pertaining to its policies, plans, and objectives Ability to develop peer relationships with senior executives, cross functional teams, customers, and program manager Education:Typically requires a University Degree or equivalent experience and less than 2 years prior relevant experience.Work Authorization Required: U.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are authorized to access information under this program/contract.

About RF: ReliabilityFirst Corporation is a regulator focused on the reliability and security of the electric grid. ReliabilityFirst’s mission is to preserve and enhance the reliability, security, and resilience of the Bulk Power System across 13 states and the District of Columbia. ReliabilityFirst is uniquely positioned to work closely with transmission, generation, and other power companies as well as the federal government to help identify and ensure the mitigation of operational risks and physical and cyber security threats to the electric grid.  Purpose of Position: The Data Analytics Intern requires you to perform day-to-day activities associated with analyzing and maximizing the data sources and outputs available in the Analytic Services group; and to perform, organize and conduct analytical activities and projects to support the quantification of grid reliability. It is also desirable for this position to be responsible for the quality and timeliness of specific business deliverables. This position will also support and implement the policies and programs established by ReliabilityFirst. Key Responsibilities: 1. Ability to support Analytical activities such as SQL queries and coding.2. Ability to support organizational activities associated with the Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence (BI) reports and dashboards, and others as needed.3. Ability to support design and creation of database tables and views in SQL from predefined data sources. 4. Ability to support Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) processes for the tables created above.5. Ability to support unit testing including test plan creation, execution, and documentation in preparation for code review and migration/elevation. Qualifications: 1. Progress in pursuing bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science or Analytics field.2. Computer skills: familiar with Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel and Power Point.   Desirable:1. An understanding of or experience with any of various languages such as SQL, Python, R, and DAX.2. Practical skills in Excel with knowledge of spreadsheet functionality including v-look-up and pivot tables.3. An understanding of or experience with Power BI or any similar business intelligence tool.4. An understanding of data manipulation, data analysis, database use, and mathematics.  ReliabilityFirst is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees and applicants in accordance with local and federal laws. ReliabilityFirst's mission is to preserve and enhance bulk power system reliability and security. This mission cannot be accomplished without a diverse and inclusive staff - one that at all levels feels empowered, valued, respected, and engaged. Learn more at: Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at RF (rfirst.org)

SANDOW DESIGN GROUP is home to the design brands you know and love like INTERIOR DESIGN Media, METROPOLIS, THINKLAB, and more. At SANDOW DESIGN GROUP (SDG), we are part of a fully remote team, with a digital-first parent company. This means we hire the best talent for the job, regardless of geographic location.As Marketing Programs Specialist, you'll play a vital role across our portfolio of industry-leading award programs as part of the Inbound Marketing Team. With a sharp eye for detail and a proven track record of driving program growth, you’ll serve as the cornerstone of our client engagement and program execution. In this multi-faceted role, you’ll manage day-to-day operations of awards programs, lead cross-team coordination of asset production, and proactively engage with key stakeholders to ensure the fulfillment of client needs and achievement of growth targets.Your digital marketing expertise will be invaluable in optimizing our programs, ensuring their configuration and management with precision, as well as serving as the touchpoint for internal and external client inquiries. Your analytical skills will guide the strategic handling of data configuration, audience segmentation, and the identification of cross-program synergies. If you are driven by nurturing client relationships and crafting campaigns that captivate, this role is your arena to excel. How will you make a difference?As the Marketing Programs Specialist, you will support the SANDOW DESIGN GROUP team in the following ways:1. Manage the day-to-day operations of multiple awards programs while contributing to their strategic direction.2. Actively configure and maintain program platforms and technology, process submissions via platform tools, and respond promptly to award-related queries from all stakeholders.3. Independently manage program efforts including tasks, communications, and reporting while working closely with cross-functional partners such as creative, editorial, and content teams.4. Drive program growth and adoption via development of strategic promotional and partnership activations.What you will do:In this role, you’ll be responsible for the tactical implementation of marketing programs with a focus on audience development and customer nurturing to drive measurable results. Here are a few of the core responsibilities:Administer and provide day-to-day oversight, configuration, and optimization for internal Marketing Technology platforms, managing independent marketing tasks and project management without oversight to ensure seamless operations.Execute the meticulous organization and management of large-scale data configurations for digital publishing and communications.Coordinate internal resources and third-party vendors for the management of marketing assets, fostering collaborative relationships that enhance the execution of marketing strategies.Measure and assess marketing strategies to optimize effectiveness and deliver regular reports and analysis on key metrics.Recommend innovative solutions to challenges and continuously drive improvements to meet program benchmarks.Compensation/Benefits:Competitive salary: Commensurate with skill set, experience and the position needed.True opportunity for growth: Our culture promotes mastering of your craft as well as intrapreneurship.Comprehensive health benefits & other benefits.Formal and informal mentorship opportunities.Keys for your Success2-5 years of hands-on experience configuring marketing technology platforms and collaborating on digital marketing initiatives, with demonstrated expertise in managing, manipulating, and synthesizing large volumes of data.Someone who is naturally self-motivated, highly organized, and exceedingly detail oriented. Thrives in collaborative remote team environments.Strong verbal and written communication skills that leave an impact.Proficiency with Excel, project management tools (such as ClickUp) and digital marketing platforms/CRMs, preferably in HubSpot. Familiarity with awards program management software such as OpenWater or AwardsForce advantageous but not mandatory.Our Commitment to YouWe will continually innovate and find new ways to stay meaningfully connected in this virtual world.We will value your fresh eyes and listen to your perspective.We have high expectations and will be clear with our expectations for your availability but will also honor yours.What to Expect:Apply through our LinkedIn job posting. If we think you meet enough of the criteria written above, someone from our HR team will reach out to schedule an introductory call. Because we respect our time and yours, you will notice a part of our process is leveraging video interviewing. We welcome a tik-tok resume at any point in the process. We welcome you to digitally explore our brand, our team members, and come to this process ready to discuss why you want to join us here at SANDOW DESIGN GROUP and what you will uniquely bring to our team and our culture.

This is a remote position. Junior Data Scientist (1 year experience, remote)Be part of our future! This job posting builds our talent pool for potential future openings. We'll compare your skills and experience. Against both current and future needs. If there's a match, we'll contact you directly. No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from the US/Canada residents during the application process. Hiring Type: Full-Time Base Salary: $59K-$69K Per Annum.Responsibilities:Partner with engineers, product managers, and business partners to identify algorithmic problems, brainstorm possible approaches, and recommend the best path forward. Develop algorithms iteratively, building in the right level of complexity to solve the business problem at hand and support future improvements. Define success criteria for your models so that you can measure impact and changes over time. You'll be expected to communicate findings and drive continuous improvements. Collaborate with Software Engineers to implement algorithms in production that scale gracefully. Collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize projects and define requirements. Carry out analysis of data produced by our hardware systems and create insightful visualizations to share your findings. Contribute to internal libraries to help other teams with their data science needs including visualization, prediction, optimization, and inference. Requirements & Experience:Advanced proficiency with Python and libraries commonly used for data analysis, e.g., Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, and Matplotlib. Strong understanding of data modeling and statistical analysis. Knowledge of optimization and predictive modeling techniques and experience applying them to real-world problems. Skilled at translating a general question or problem into a clearly defined algorithmic solution. Ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Nice to haves:1-year Experience with Data Bricks or PySpark 1 year Experience with product ionizing data models

column2: Florida Bar Exam Essay Grader - Contract (REMOTE)
column6: Quimbee has a massive library of content designed to help law students and attorneys succeed, every step of the way. Not only do we help law students succeed in law school and on the bar exam, but Quimbee is also equally committed to building a premier collection of courses designed to satisfy attorneys' MCLE requirements. Quimbee can be accessed on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. We are seeking experienced bar exam graders to help our law students pass the bar!This position is 100% remote. All you need is an internet connection and a quiet place to work.OverviewWe are looking for exceptional attorneys and legal educators who are passionate about providing feedback to law students on bar exam essays. This is a position of great trust and responsibility.Who We're Looking ForYou're a really smart lawyer. This means you have a JD from an accredited law school. You excelled in law school and aced the bar thereafter. You're the kind of person law students will respect receiving feedback from, and you thoroughly enjoy providing it to them.You're an exceptional legal writer. Ideally, you served on a law journal (law review would be even better). If you got something published, then that's extra points. You understand that less is more, details matter, and small words are better than big words.You're a detail-oriented self-starter: You're disciplined and motivated and the kind of person who doesn't need someone looking over your shoulder to make sure you're doing your job.RequirementsMinimum:A JD from an accredited U.S. law schoolMust be a licensed attorney, in good standing, in any Florida jurisdictionMust be comfortable working in a collaborative and remote team environmentPreferred:2 years of experience in the active practice and/or teaching of lawPast bar exam essay grading experienceBenefits100% remote$35 per essay

OFFICE / HR COORDINATORLOCATION: NYC - LESEMPLOYMENT STATUS: FULL TIMEDEPARTMENT: ADMINISTRATIVE REPORTS TO: HR DIRECTOR WITH DOTTED LINE TO EXECUTIVE ASSISTANTSALARY RANGE: $62,400 - $65,000 (DEPENDING ON EXPERIENCE)Founded in 2013, Fohr is an influencer marketing platform. We’ve built a self-serve platform that allows you to run the best influencer marketing campaigns imaginable. We run and manage campaigns from $25,000 to a million dollars, from one influencer to 4,000. We are currently seeking a full-time Office / HR Coordinator to join our dynamic team! This opportunity has a key role in supporting our Employees, HR Director, and the Executive Assistant. POSITION SUMMARY The Office / HR Coordinator, will be a hybrid role in which the majority of your focus will be about 65% focused on the Office Coordinator responsibilities and about 35% will focus on the HR Coordinator responsibilities. This can fluctuate based on business needs. You will perform diverse office duties and HR Coordinator functions requiring a high level of confidentiality, initiative, and sound decision-making. This role will report to the HR Director with a dotted line into the Executive Assistant. You would require experience within HR on an entry level, managing onboarding and HRIS system entry. This role can potentially grow into a full time HR role within 1 to 2 years, if there is an interest. You will rely on excellent organizational skills and the ability to effectively handle multiple priorities. You will need to adapt procedures, processes, and techniques to the completion of assignments. You will be working cross departmentally. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES Office Coordinator:Coordinate team wide calendars, events, office wide announcements (eg. holiday party, birthdays, office closures etc.)Manage office budget and prioritizing spending.Update and maintain a series of ongoing spreadsheets.Implement systems to streamline office operations and protocols.Coordinate employee life events, celebrations and achievements.Coordinate internal anniversary gifting - varsity jacket, pins, Rimowa coordination and production.Book employee travel for client visits.Office Upkeep:Manage all aspects of office space - decoration, organization, etc. Update visuals as needed. Coordinate with external vendors and building management in regards to any maintenance needs for HVAC, plumbing, electrical, garbage disposal, appliances, etc. Coordinate with third party contractors for any work to be done in the office.Coordinate weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual maintenance visits.Maintain close contact with building superintendent and management.Work with cleaners/day porters on daily routine and maintenance.Stock and organize supplies (office supplies, toiletries, refreshments, etc).Coordinate, organize and execute all Fohr events, both in office and off site. Eg. team celebrations events, off site workshops, client lunches, internal meetings.Welcome, greet, direct visitors and deliveries.Sorting correspondence and packages.Assist with client and holiday gifting - create fedex labels, boxing, shipping, handling, etc.  Assist Executive Assistant with any CEO needs and errands when need be.Hr Coordinator: Manage new hire onboarding - running it, updating the deck and partnering with IT with equipment. Ensuring new hires complete paperwork.Completion of verification of I-9s. Upkeep the HRIS system with employee data, we currently use Trinet. Upkeep Talent Review Platform with employee information, we currently use Culture Amp. Answer and manager tier one questions and assist with report requests.Assist HR Director with planning and executing of DEI events.Assist HR Director with sourcing resumes for open positions. EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & PERSONAL ATTRIBUTESOffice Coordinator:At least 2 years of prior experience.Tech Savvy. Great with multitasking. Ideal candidate has a background in a similar field.Extremely well organized, methodical and detailed oriented.Must be able to lift 50 lbs over their head and is confident using all tools within a standard toolbox kit. HR Coordinator:1-2 years of experience in an entry level HR role required.Would require at least 1 year of experience of resume sourcing.A degree or certification in HR is highly preferred.Must have onboarding and HRIS experience.Manage confidentiality within a high level. Overall:Tact and good judgment in confidential situations and proven experience interacting with leadership.Proficient knowledge of MS Word, Excel, Office Pro and Key Note.Proficient in G Suite related applications. (Drive, Docs, Sheets, etc).Experience with event coordination.PERKS & CULTURE Fohr offers a competitive salary and benefits package including:Medical, Dental, Vision, Long and Short-term Disability401K with matchingCommuter and Flex SpendingFlexible Vacation Pet friendly environmentUpbeat, stylish studio space with a bar in the officeSummer Fridays and one week winter office closerOur culture is rooted in internal and external partnership, collaboration, and respect.Our team of 90ish people is based in the Lower East Side of New York City. We love our work, we’re passionate about what we’re doing, and we aren’t afraid to try new things and have fun doing them. We hire people for the way their brains work, their drive, and their charisma.We also believe it’s time to reinvent the advertising industry, and the first step is a team that’s dedicated to the cause. FOHR VALUES Everything we do is rooted in our Fohr Values: Excellence – We strive not just for your best, but for a level right beyond that high mark.Individuality – We have a Fohr way of doing things / Thinking differently is in our DNA.Curiosity – We seek to understand the things we don’t agree with, we investigate ideas before discarding them and question the status quo instead of following it.Ownership - We are dependable and deliver on expectations.Camaraderie – We look to build meaningful relationships in the workplace.Optimism – We believe deeply in the potential of our colleagues and clients and give the support and encouragement needed to reach that potential.EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT Fohr is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local laws.

The Director of Operations is a key member of the Senior Leadership Team. The Director of Operations will lead and mentor the Company operations leaders. The Director of Operations will work closely with the Executive Leadership Team and plan, coordinate, and oversee operations activities in the Company and EDP dental practices. The Director's work with result in optimized operations and identification and implementation of cost effective systems and solutions to meet the current and evolving needs of the organization.Director of Operations Job Responsibilities:• Collaborates with executive leadership to develop and meet company goals while supplying expertise and guidance on operations projects and systems• Establishes, implements, and communicates the strategic direction of the organization’s operations• Collaborates with other divisions and departments to carry out the organization’s goals and objectives• Oversees operational activities of the company• Develops, leads and mentors operational leaders• Ensures operations team leaders and their teams are properly trained• Responsible for ensuring operational leadership and their teams have easy electronic access to revenue cycle metrics relating to the centers. Responsible for ensuring we have metrics and goals to measure performance that are well communicated and administered.• Identifies, recommends, and implements cost effective processes, technologies, and systems to improve and streamline organizational processes and use of resources and materials• Ensures that departmental decisions and project plans such as those for staffing, development, column6: Job DescriptionThe Assistant Program Director is responsible for the coordination of all admissions into the program. They are responsible for documentation training and all documentation chart reviews. They should work directly with the MM to ensure all charts are up to date each day and all documentation is complete. The Assistant Program Director consults with the Administrator/Director and may consult with the Operations department on an as needed basis (however, receives direct supervision from the Program Director/Administrator), to ensure the best, most efficient utilization of program and company resources.The Assistant Program Director closely supervises all daily milieu activities and ensures that the house runs on the posted schedule each day. The Assistant Program Director collaborates with the Administrator/Director to develop a program of in-service training and continuing education for the counseling staff.ResponsibilitiesTo supervise all milieu activities to ensure that all services are in keeping with the Discovery Mission Statement.To supervise in collaboration with the Administrator/Director the Counseling treatment staff.Collaborates with The Administrator/Director to implement continual quality improvement activities for the treatment program.Participates in the interview process with the Administrator/Director in a collaborative fashion to determine the appropriateness and qualifications of prospective counseling staff members.Will arrange with the admissions department and coordinate with the facility all admissions and ensure they are completed.Is available by telephone evenings and weekends & manages crisis or emergency transfers as needed.Regularly audit the clinical records and holds counseling staff accountable for maintaining appropriate standards for documentation unless otherwise directed by the Program Administrator.Evaluate and apprise each member of the counseling staff, completes a written narrative (annual performance review) clearly identifying strengths, weaknesses, and goals for the coming year. Counseling reviews are forwarded to the Human Resource Manager.When indicated facilitates disciplinary actions in collaboration with the Administrator/Director, the Operations Department and if indicated the Human Resource Manager.Works with the Administrator/Director to arrange staff coverage to meet the needs of the program.This is a full-time position working Mon-Fri or Tues-Sat 8:30-6pmFor a virtual tour of the facility, please visit our website at (url removed).

What is EthSign?Built on Arweave, EthSign Next is our major pivot into the world outside EVM-compatible blockchains. It allows not only users from different blockchain systems, but really anyone who possesses a cryptographic keypair to digitally sign, encrypt, and permanently store documents and independently verify their validity. The user interface has received another facelift and numerous quality-of-life features have been added based on feedback from EthSign 4. Now, Alice from Bitcoin can seamlessly sign documents with Bob from Ethereum, Caine from TON, and Sam from Solana. There are no more smart contracts to interact with and since storage on Arweave is so cheap, we are covering all fees.This positionWe are looking for experienced visual designers to build a new branding set for the project. Visual designers are expected to improve design usability and aesthetic appeal with graphics, typography, layout, and color system. ResponsibilityBranding and Identity:Develop and implement a cohesive and visually appealing branding system that aligns with EthSign's values and objectives.Create and maintain brand guidelines to ensure consistency across all touchpoints.Graphic Design:Design engaging and impactful graphics for a variety of applications, including marketing materials, website assets, social media content, and more.Collaborate with marketing and other teams to translate concepts into visually stunning designs.3D Modeling:Produce high-quality 3D models that enhance our visual storytelling and elevate the overall brand experience.Implement 3D elements into various projects, including presentations, product visuals, and promotional materials.Simple Animations:Create simple yet effective animations to enhance the user experience on digital platforms.Integrate animations into marketing videos, presentations, and other multimedia content.Collaboration:Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and contribute creative ideas.Collaborate with external vendors and partners to ensure consistency in branding across all channels.

Job OverviewSocial Benefit is seeking a Senior Customer Success Manager to join our team. This individual will report to the Head of Customer Experience and play a pivotal role in ensuring that Navigator users are able to take full advantage of the tool’s capabilities to navigate government benefits and tax credits so they can maximize economic mobility for their clients or themselves. Responsibilities:● Serve as the voice of Case Worker and Agency customers, representing their needs and priorities to the entire Social Benefit team and influencing the end-to-end customer experience. ● Develop and lead the Account Management function. This includes managing implementation and day-to-day operations with our customers and partnering with the Navigator’s co-founders and Head of Customer Experience to proactively identify and resolve customer-specific issues. ● Develop and lead the Training and Support function to meet the needs of our customers, case managers, and clients/individuals. This includes hiring and growing the team responsible for training and support resources for the Navigator product, benefits and tax credits, and how to most effectively help people navigate this landscape. ● Lead and facilitate Group Trainings in person and on Zoom for new and current customers.● Manage 1:1 assisted support staff, operations, and associated tools and technology (ZenDesk).● Provide input to product roadmap based on partner and user feedback and your knowledge and experience.● Partner with leadership team on customer/user communications strategy. Deliver communications based on this strategy.● Support operational processes to keep Navigator customers and users confident and current on benefit and tax credit policies and ensure that the product, training, and customer resources are accurate. ● Regularly assess and report on performance against established KPIs.● Partner with leadership team to identify hiring needs and build the team that will grow with the business.● Guide the work described above from startup mode to scalable models. ● Contribute to strategic decision-making processes and actively participate in the overall vision and growth of the company.  Qualifications:● 7+ years’ experience in case management, including managing case managers.● Deep knowledge of the Los Angeles County benefit systems and key entities within this system.● Demonstrated ability to transfer experience and knowledge into sustainable programs and resources.● Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams within and across organizations.● Learning mindset and comfortable moving between hands-on execution and planning / building for scale, with the judgment to balance immediate and long-term needs.

column2: Senior Equity Analyst - Multi-Billion Long/Short Hedge Fund
column6: A rare opportunity to join one of the world's most successful hedge funds has arisen to join their highly regarded equities team as a Senior Equity Analyst. The prestigious business has a long positive track record and every year goes from strength to strength. The fund's Equity business is their core offering and continues to outperform the market. The firm is looking to hire a Senior Analyst to work in their New York office, supporting a successful Portfolio Manager on a +$3bn AUM portfolio. They harness technology better than almost all of their competitors and operate more like a fintech firm than a traditional hedge fund, reflected both through their investment strategy and their company culture.The candidate will have either buy-side Long/Short of Long-Only experience.

No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from the US/Canada residents during the application process. Hiring Type: Full-Time Base Salary: $57K-$67K Per Annum.Responsibilities:Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand software requirements and specifications. Participate in the creation and execution of test plans, test cases, and test scripts. Identify, document, and track software defects and issues using bug-tracking tools. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Detail-oriented with a keen eye for identifying issues and inconsistencies. Effective communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Experience with testing tools and bug-tracking systems is a plus.

The Department designates the specific three days of the week Employees must work on-site. U.S. citizenship or current authorization to work in the U.S. required and no current or future work authorization sponsorship available. Southwest Airlines is an Equal Opportunity Employer. column2: Chief Operating Officer – High Growth Facility Services Roll-Up – Private Equity, 78801
column6: Chief Operating Officer – High Growth Facility Services Roll-Up – Private Equity Our client is a growing middle market facility services business primarily serving commercial customers. They are seeking an experienced Chief Operating Officer to lead an aggressive growth strategy under the direction of new private equity owners. This position will oversee a dispersed workforce that is rapidly expanding to serve a national customer base. The business serves customers through a network of field service branch locations and is looking for an executive leader with an owner mentality to build a highly effective team while professionalizing operations as the business continues to scale. We are seeking an experienced and driven Chief Operating Officer with a demonstrated ability to execute and lead the build out of an entrepreneurial facility services business in partnership with investors. You will have a successful track record of creating a culture of performance and operational excellence while managing a dispersed team that have come in through acquisitions. Ideally the COO will have experience in managing an aggressive growth strategy through M&A. The ideal candidate may have come out of HVAC, mechanical, electrical, fire life and safety, plumbing or other industrial services. It will be a strong asset to have had previous experience driving operations within a private equity sponsored or investor-led enterprise.This position offers the opportunity to build and grow a business through its next stage of growth in partnership with a highly motivated investment partner. Base compensation and bonus will be competitive along with an attractive equity incentive.
