column2: Uniform Bar Exam Essay Grader - Contract (REMOTE)
column6: Quimbee has a massive library of content designed to help law students and attorneys succeed, every step of the way. Not only do we help law students succeed in law school and on the bar exam, but Quimbee is also equally committed to building a premier collection of courses designed to satisfy attorneys' MCLE requirements. Quimbee can be accessed on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. We are seeking experienced bar exam graders to help our law students pass the bar!This position is 100% remote. All you need is an internet connection and a quiet place to work.OverviewWe are looking for exceptional attorneys and legal educators who are passionate about providing feedback to law students on bar exam essays. This is a position of great trust and responsibility.Who We're Looking ForYou're a really smart lawyer. This means you have a JD from an accredited law school. You excelled in law school and aced the bar thereafter. You're the kind of person law students will respect receiving feedback from, and you thoroughly enjoy providing it to them.You're an exceptional legal writer. Ideally, you served on a law journal (law review would be even better). If you got something published, then that's extra points. You understand that less is more, details matter, and small words are better than big words.You're a detail-oriented self-starter: You're disciplined and motivated and the kind of person who doesn't need someone looking over your shoulder to make sure you're doing your job.RequirementsMinimum:A JD from an accredited U.S. law schoolMust be a licensed attorney, in good standing, in any UBE jurisdictionMust be comfortable working in a collaborative and remote team environmentPreferred:2 years of experience in the active practice and/or teaching of lawPast bar exam essay grading experienceBenefits100% remote$35 per essay

Help Help DutiesWHAT IS THE WAGE & INVESTMENT CARE CUSTOMER ASSISTANCE, RELATIONSHIP AND EDUCATIONDIVISION?A description of the business units can be found at: https://www.jobs.irs.gov/about/who/business-divisionsThe following are the duties of this position at the full working level. If this vacancy includes more than one grade and you are selected at a lower grade level, you will have the opportunity to learn to perform these duties and receive training to help you grow in this position.Activates, monitors, and controls job distribution and resource allocation for special processing requirements to link internal operating systems and utility programs with application programs, peripheral equipment, teleprocessing and input/output channels.Monitors systems status and performance, observes and responds to system messages, and defines, isolates, and resolves a wide range of common equipment and operating problems, failures and malfunctions. Assists in developing new or revised operating procedures.Run and monitor test programs to identify problems or potential for obvious problems such as memory overload. Corrects or adjusts priorities and workflow by reconfiguring equipment.Performs other duties as assigned.

DSJ Global is partnered with a leading food manufacturing organization that is rapidly expanding! The team is looking for a Global Director of Continuous Improvement (remote) to join their team.With this position, you will play a pivotal role in driving operational excellence initiatives across our food manufacturing facilities located in two countries. Your primary focus will be on Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) and Lean methodologies to optimize processes, enhance productivity, and ensure the highest quality standards are consistently met.Responsibilities of the OPEX Director Include: Develop and Implement Operational Excellence Strategies: Design and implement comprehensive operational excellence strategies aligned with business objectives, emphasizing TPM and Lean principles.Multi-Site Leadership: Provide leadership and direction to operational teams across multiple manufacturing sites located in different countries.TPM Implementation: Lead TPM initiatives to minimize equipment downtime, improve overall equipment effectiveness (OEE), and enhance asset utilization.Lean Manufacturing: Drive Lean manufacturing practices to streamline processes, eliminate waste, and optimize resource utilization across all production areas.Continuous Improvement: Champion a culture of continuous improvement by fostering innovation, identifying areas for optimization, and implementing solutions to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including production, engineering, quality assurance, and supply chain to ensure alignment and integration of operational excellence initiatives.Qualifications of the OPEX Director Include: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Operations Management, or a related field.Extensive experience (8+ years) in operational leadership roles within the food manufacturing industry.Proven track record of implementing TPM and Lean methodologies to drive operational improvements and achieve business objectives.Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate cross-functional teams.Certification in TPM, Lean Six Sigma, or related methodologies is a plus.able to travel up to 40%

The Executive Assistant will manage and oversee the administrative operations, main responsibility is to support the President and the Chief Executive Officer. This position has high visibility to our various leadership teams and has a wide range responsibilities from administrative duties, project managing, and support-related tasks, including general community and Board responsibilities as well as internal relationship management and general operational responsibilities. If you are an experienced Executive Assistant that is confident, polished, and is driven to get things done, this may be your next career move.Responsibilities:• Manage and maintain the office of the President & CEO in a professional and efficient manner to ensure excellent customer service to internal, and external, constituents on her behalf. Based on the unique level of confidentiality of material and interaction of this position, particular care must be considered in relation to the position of the President & CEO requiring the highest level of integrity, confidentiality, honesty and fair dealings as outlined in our Code of Ethics & Business Conduct, especially avoiding any conflict with personal interests, or even the appearance of a conflict of interest.• Maintain and support calendar for the President & CEO, coordinate and monitor meetings with executive staff and volunteers; anticipate and coordinate with staff information and materials needed to ensure that the President and CEO is prepared for meetings and events; timely gather and review all materials and information for such meetings to ensure the accuracy of the information provided; provide communication support services for calls received in the office of the President & CEO; responsible for preparation and processing of all related correspondence, including opening and sorting incoming daily mail; set-up meetings and follow through on set-ups and food orders where required; prepare and distribute materials for meetings; arrange all travel accommodations and prepare itinerary and expense report for President & CEO; prepare department check requests. Provide support for the President & CEO’s role as member of various Boards and committees outside United Way.• Maintain an organized, efficient, accessible and accurate filing system; maintain/update information in the current database system as needed.• Serve as liaison to Board, Board Committees, Trustees and community outreach by making all meeting arrangements, preparing and distributing of materials, taking notes and transcribing notes to develop minutes; prepare Board & Executive meeting material; Board attendance reports and Nominating Committee reports; assist in researching information requested by members as assigned; maintain volunteer rosters.Requirements:-Bachelor’s Degree; or equivalent experience.-Two to three years executive administrative experience.-Bilingual preferred: English/Spanish, Creole a plus-Advanced Internet Explorer, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook, Excel and functions such as Mail/Merge.QualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent experienceProficient in Microsoft Office suiteExperience in managing multiple priorities, administrative coordination, and logisticsWell-organized, detail-oriented, ability to multi-task with great follow-up skillsStrong written and verbal communication skills

We are helping our client hire two Technical Sourcers. Job Description:Working closely with the Talent Acquisition team, your sourcing efforts will contribute to building a world-class Engineering organization. You’ll partner closely with a full-cycle recruiter to serve various clients and you will build pipelines for priority roles within the Engineering organization.What you’ll do:Strategically source and build pipelines for various Software Engineering profilesDevelop creative outreach methods; we do not believe in spamming!Leverage internal tools to develop a creative and diverse talent poolDevelop creative boolean searches and become a market expert in modern technologiesManage and report your sourcing metrics and performance as an individual contributorCollaborate with members of the Recruiting team and key stakeholdersWhat we’re searching for:BA/BS degree or equivalent required3+ years experience working as a sourcer or recruiter in a top technical environmentAbility to write expert boolean searches and the use of modern sourcing technologiesExpert market knowledge and the ability to confidentially speak to potential candidatesFamiliarity with any of the following: Linkedin Recruiter, Github, Greenhouse, or equivalent ATS

- US OnlyExperience: 1+ yearsEmployment Type: Full-time, hybridBase Salary: $60K-$70KPhoenix Recruitment offers a variety of recruiting services to assist both employers and employees. They are specialized in marketing open positions, recruiting, and helping employers to find qualified candidates across various industries. Phoenix Recruitment has expertise in streamlining the hiring process. They can help ensure that the process is efficient, well organized, and compliant with relevant regulations.About The RoleAs a Junior Graphic and UI/UX Designer working in our Design team, youll play a crucial role in creating visually appealing and user-centric designs for various digital platforms. You will collaborate with senior designers, and cross-functional teams, and contribute to the overall visual and interactive aspects of our projects.Key ResponsibilitiesGraphic Design Assist in the creation of visually captivating marketing materials, presentations, and other graphic design collateral. Support the design of social media content, email campaigns, and digital marketing assets. UI/UX Design Collaborate with senior designers and product teams to produce wireframes, mockups, and prototypes for websites and mobile apps. Help create user-centered designs that align with project goals and user requirements. Contribute to the development of intuitive user experiences by participating in design discussions and ideation sessions. Design Support Assist in maintaining design guidelines and standards to ensure consistency across various projects. Stay updated with design trends, tools, and best practices to enhance your design skills and contribute innovative ideas. QualificationsBachelors degree or equivalent in Graphic Design, UI/UX Design, or a related field. A portfolio showcasing your graphic design and UI/UX skills, including projects and examples. Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, XD), or similar software. Basic understanding of UI/UX principles and a strong desire to learn and grow in this field. Attention to detail and effective communication of design concepts. Ability to work collaboratively in a team, adapt to feedback, and incorporate changes into designs. Strong attention to detail. Organized and reliable. Able and willing to present designs to groups of stakeholders. Preferred SkillsBasic knowledge of HTML/CSS and responsive design principles Why Phoenix Recruitment LLC?Phoenix Recruitment often has an extensive network of employers and candidates. This network allows them to tap into a pool of qualified candidates and connect them with suitable job opportunities. They can also leverage their connections to help employers find the right talent efficiently. Outsourcing the recruitment process to a specialized agency can save you time and resources, avoid delays, reduce administrative burdens, and increase the chances of finding the right fit for your organization.

Facility DetailsFacility: Please Contact for facility infoFacility Type: Short Term Acute Care HospitalNumber Of Beds: 142Trauma Center: NoPediatric Trauma Center: NoCharting System: Oracle Cerner, Oracle Cerner - HealtheLife, Oracle Cerner - Oracle Cerner-Millennium, Oracle Cerner - Oracle Cerner-PowerChart, Press GaneyJob DetailsStarts: 04/08/2024Assignment Length: 13Shift: Not IndicatedCall Off Policy: Please Contact for InfoJob Quantity: 1Type: TravelJob DescriptionInterested in making a positive impact? You’ve come to the right place. At Fusion Medical Staffing, our goal is to improve the lives of everyone we touch, and we’re always looking for people like you to join our mission.And making a difference isn’t the only perk of traveling with us. Start your medical travel career with Fusion Medical Staffing and gain access to competitive pay packages, comprehensive benefits, corporate discounts and perks, a clinical team to support you along your journey, and a recruiter determined to help you succeed. We’ve got your back so you can focus on what you do best: helping others._______________________________________________________Registered Nurse - Emergency RoomPosition: Registered NurseSpecialty: Emergency Room13 week Emergency Room Registered Nurse travel assignmentClient in is looking for a Emergency Room Registered Nurse to help them out for 13 weeks.At Fusion Medical, we truly believe that as people taking care of people, together we can do anything.Benefits IncludePaid Time Off (PTO) after 1560 hoursHighly competitive payBest in the industry Medical, Dental, and VisionShort term disability401(k)Aggressive Refer-a-friend Bonus ProgramYour recruiter is available 24-7Reimbursement for licensure and CEU’s Qualifications/Requirements:One to three years experience as a Registered Nurse preferredOther certifications may be required for this positionCritical thinking, service excellence and good interpersonal communication skills, ability to read/comprehend written instructions, ability to follow verbal instructions, PC skillsPhysical Abilities: Remain in a stationary position, move about, move equipment (50-100lbs), pushing, pulling, bending. The following is a summary of the major job duties of this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time. Communicates and collaborates with physicians and other health team members. Provides and coordinates patient care with other health team members. Monitors patients' responses to interventions and reports outcomes. Administers medications as ordered with appropriate documentation. Monitor and evaluates patients before, during, and post procedure depending on unit. Shares on-call responsibilities with a 30-minute response time if required. Maintains cleanliness of rooms and adequate stock of supplies. Transports patients as needed. Performs other duties as assigned. Required Essential SkillsInterpersonal Skills - to work effectively with a variety of personnel (professional and ancillary) to present a positive attitude and a professional appearance. Technical/Motor Skills - Ability to grasp, fine manipulation, pushing/pulling and able to move about when assisting with procedures and/or using department equipment. Mental Requirements - Must be able to cope with frequent contact with the general public, customers, and meeting deadlines under pressure. Must be able to work under close supervision occasionally as well as working without assistance from other personnel. Must be able to contend with irregular activity schedules occasionally and continuous concentration to detail. Sensory - Visual acuity, ability to effectively communicate **Fusion is an EOE/E-Verify Employer**

JOB SUMMARYNABA, Inc. is seeking an enthusiastic, highly energetic, full-time individual who wants to use their talents and skills for the advancement of Black Business professionals. If you are a motivated self-starter committed to social impact outcomes with a focus on professional development program(s), join our team. NABA, Inc. is a nonprofit membership association dedicated to bridging the opportunity gap for Black Business Leaders in accounting, finance business, and entrepreneurship. Representing more than 200,000 Black Business Leaders in these fields, NABA advances people, careers, and the mission by providing education, resources, and meaningful careerconnections to professional and student members.JOB DESCRIPTIONESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:The primary work of the Manager is working with the Associate Director to support the CEO in ensuring effectiveness and efficiency in her schedule and follow through in the work. In collaboration with the Associate Director, they will partner with the CEO to set up systems and support to run effectively and move the work forward.To be successful in this role, you will bring a strategic mind and collaborative approach to leadership, enjoying the challenge of constantly and consistently improving operational efficiency and performance in a fast-paced environment. In addition, you will be skilled at anticipating the needs of others and proactively taking on new challenges to support business and people's needs. Ideally, you bring strong business and financial management experience with a focused, thoughtful approach to strategy and planning.GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:Project Management (60 %):• Lead and facilitate processes and systems to implement projects and programs on behalf of NABA• Structure planning, implementation, and post-implementation processes and systems on behalf of key NABA projects• Ensure great communication between all stakeholders in project planning and implementation• Contribute to the growing body of knowledge of projects and programs to improve our work and enhance our missionTeam Collaboration and Communication (20%):• Create efficient, timely systems of communications and support, from executive updates to staff briefings that ensure that essential information is shared. Create models of these programs and execute them in the highest priority projects.• Serve as a resource for communications systems for teammates• Ensure a culture of excellence by creating and executing practices that empower staff, enable speed and flexibility, and maintain the highest quality of service with operations• Advise leadership and develop strategies for leading and managing change, inclusive of strategies for change communication, resistance, risk mitigation, coaching, and trainingOperational Systems (20%):• Lead the development and standardization of day-to-day operational systems, participating in both executive-level and detail-level decision-making on the full range of market activities• Build and nurture critical relationships with key stakeholders that support capacity building, growth, and operational efficiency• As a member of the leadership team, make decisions to ensure the most efficient utilization of resources• Oversee development and implementation of facilities plan to manage and operate facilities• Embrace and take on ad hoc issues related to operationsREQUIRED JOB QUALIFICATIONSEducation and Experience Requirement(s):• 3 –5 years of experience in Executive support and operations• Excellent flexibility and adaptability with a strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit to accommodate significant responsibilities and shifting priorities• Superior organizational skills and attention to detail• Strong executive presence• Exceptional oral and written communication skills• Ability to make firm strategic decisions in a dynamic and fast-paced environment• Strong time management skills and the ability to thrive under pressure• Proficiency in Microsoft Office with strong PowerPoint and Excel skills• A passion for working with people, an unshakable belief in their potential, and a strong commitment to the mission of NABA, IncKnowledge, Skills, and Abilities:• Must possess strong leadership qualities• Must have strong organizational, analytical, and coordinating abilities• Ability to work as part of a team• Excellent problem-solving abilities• Must be creative and able to prioritize tasks in the face of many challenges• Ability to supervise and work in a team environment (as needed)• Ability to work independently and work under deadlines• Proven stakeholder management skills• Commitment to organizational mission and valuesCompetencies:• Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands, changes approaches or methods to best fit the situation, able to deal with frequent changes, delays, or unexpected events.• Planning/Organization - Priorities and plans work activities, uses time efficiently, develops realistic action plans• Quality Management - Looks for ways to improve and promote quality, demonstrates accuracy and thoughtfulness• Initiative - takes initiative in appropriate situations and goes beyond expectations when necessary.• Relationships - develops relationships based upon trust, respect, and commitment to NABA’s mission• Understanding organizational values/Culture alignment - Tactfully approaches others, reacts well under pressure, treats others with respect and consideration, accepts responsibility for own actions, and follows through on commitments.Physical Requirements:• Ability to communicate and exchange information as well as use a computer.• Office/Remote working environment• Ability to transport up to 20 lbs.• DMV residence preferred but not mandatoryDIVERSITY STATEMENT:As an equal-opportunity employer, NABA is committed to a diverse, multicultural work environment. NABA does not discriminate in employment based on age, race, creed, gender, religion, marital status, veteran’s status, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, and/or other protected status as required by applicable law.ORGANIZATION BACKGROUND:The mission of NABA is to address the professional needs of its members and to build leaders that shape the future of the accounting and finance profession with an unfaltering commitment to inspire the same in their successors.NABA’s vision is for unlimited opportunities and growth for Black business leaders in accounting and related business professions. Learn more about NABA's vision at www.nabainc.org/vision.BENEFITS:This position offers a competitive compensation package, including full medical and dental benefits; disability insurance; life insurance; and retirement fund options.

tldr; We build software for Airbnbs to rent themselves, with a state-of-the-art product and user experience.We have crafted an Applicant Handbook, which we highly recommend you check out, where you can find out more about the company, culture, how we recruit, what we do, and how we do it.We believe in the value of team diversity and seek candidates from a wide range of backgrounds in their work, life, culture, and experiences.We are bold, like risks, and take on big challenges together. Our customers love the product, provide valuable feedback, and trust us to rapidly help them with more of their problems.Feel free to join in one of our upcoming Townhalls on YouTube to experience it for yourself!We are looking for a stellar individual to join our leadership team and run our support organization as a Head of Support.What you will be working on?As a Head of Support, your mission will be to create a support organization that is able to handle 20x the load of today. In order to fulfill your mission, you will:Run and own the day-to-day of our support team, over 25 people strong, across 3 teams (APAC, EU, US) and 2 major product lines (Core Saas, Direct)As a people-first leader, coach and mentor our team. In doing so, create performance level standards focused on response times and resolution and ensure those standards are met, while striving to exceed. You will be owning all support OKRs & KPIs across the departmentCollaborate with our Principal Support AdvocateIdentify and lead process improvements to drive a consistent, scalable, and process-driven approach to Support; personally seek out opportunities to leverage automation, content and tooling to ensure a scalable modelDirect and oversee all aspects of an organization's customer support policies, objectives, and initiatives (including adding new channels of support such as phone support), and ensure those are consistently applied across our support organizationParticipate in managing customer escalations and engage with those customers to triage their issues via tickets and video conferencingCraft and manage the support team spending with ongoing analysis; Forecast hiring needs and be the hiring manager for all necessary talent for a successful support teamStay up to date in the industry and monitor new trends, opportunities, technology, and methods for providing world-class customer supportReport to the CEO, and provide the Support team's input in all company initiativesRequirementsHospitable.com is a remote-only and fully distributed company. For this position, your location is not a requirement. The ideal fit would work under American or European time zones.Don’t tick all the boxes? Talk to us about why you’re still an amazing fit.To be successful, you will be an innovative problem solver who is dependable, committed, and passionate about customer supportExperience in a Leadership role within an online customer support environment, preferably SaaS-basedExperience with change management and implementationKnowing that Jenn's favorite color is tealAn analytical nature with a high expectation of standards of workExperience reporting data, providing analyses, and measuring improvementBenefitsThe company itself is also a product, one that we iterate on. We're always improving and creating an environment where we all love to work.A supportive and caring team environment, where you are trusted, not managedThe total cost of employment for this role is within $158,184.00 — $175,760.00 depending on the cost of living in your location. We can hire talent internationally as contractors – or employees if you are based in the United States, the European Union, or Australia, taking into account payroll taxes out of this budget to determine your gross compensationWe also offer an extra incentive into our equity with RSUs through our $HOST token, with a grant amount of $79,092.00 (not tied to location)For US employees: healthcare (including EPO, PPO and HSA), 401(k)35 days off per year, encouraged (including self-serve public holidays) and parental leaveMental health and emotional support with therapists on call through SlackRecognized on Inc.’s list of Best Workplaces for 2023

Job DescriptionPurpose of RoleThe Growth Insights Team is the “North Star” for the entire U.S. Spirits organization’s long-term strategy. The purpose of the Growth Insights Analyst role is to creatively leverage available internal and external data sources to research, synthesize, and report on key trends in the spirits industry with the purpose of informing operational decision-making and long-term planning.Key OutputsThe Growth Insights Team has three core functions:Long term strategy and ad-hoc consultative projectsExecutive and investor supportPerformance insights and reportingThe primary responsibility of the analyst role is to own Performance insights and reporting (#3) with the expectation that the analyst will gain increasing exposure to #1 & #2 over time as a part of the candidate’s skill development plan.Long Term Strategy And Ad-Hoc ProjectsThe Growth Insights Team is expected to have the “pulse” on where the industry is headed – in all senses of the phrase. In collaboration with the Director and Managers of Growth Insights and key stakeholders throughout Finance, Brand, and Commercial, the Growth Insights Analyst will support the production of key category, price segment, market, and retail partner trends. With time, you will also be tasked with conducting ad-hoc “deep-dive” analyses on topics of interest, in which you will be expected to effectively analyze available data, synthesize key points, and tie your analysis into the broader picture of Diageo’s overarching strategies. Ad-hoc projects are sometimes spurred by specific asks from key stakeholders, but also often “home-grown” topics identified by the Growth Insights team as critical to Diageo’s long-term success; The ideal candidate will have the intellectual curiosity and ability to see the “30,000-foot view” to contribute such ideas.Executive And Investor SupportThe Growth Insights team is tasked with keeping the executive leadership informed on key industry trends and portfolio performance in real-time. The Growth Insights Analyst will periodically produce materials for executive and commercial leadership reviews that illustrate trends in a clear and concise manner and will field questions and follow-ups where needed.The Growth Insights Team is also the most significant contributor to NAM Market Investor Relations report and has extensive responsibilities in preparing leadership for twice-annual earnings read-outs. The Growth Insights Team contributes thought leadership on economic outlook, industry trends, and Diageo performance in the U.S. marketplace.Performance Insights And ReportingThe Growth Insights Analyst, in collaboration with the Growth Insights Managers, will produce recurring reports surrounding syndicated data releases on industry and Diageo performance to keep the business informed in real-time. The Analyst will work closely with Brand and Commercial teams on follow-ups and double-clicks into key performance topics. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in an imperfect data environment and will be willing to “roll-up their sleeves” when it comes to data cleaning and mapping.Must-havesQualifications And Experience Expert data analysis and communication skillsComfort working independently without strict guidelines/oversightCollected and effective under pressure and tight timelinesCreative problem-solverAttention to detailQualificationsBachelors Degree1-2 years of experience in analytical role, ideally in strategy/management consulting or similar fieldPassion for consumer goods/beverage-alcoholExcel/PowerPoint expertNice-to-havesWorking or project experience within CPG/BevAlc a plusExperience working with syndicated data a plus, particularly Nielsen and/or National Alcohol Beverage Control dataUnderstanding of key macroeconomic trends, metrics, and data sources a plusExposure to corporate finance concepts a plusExperience with or willingness to learn PowerBI a plus, but not a prerequisiteWorker TypeRegularPrimary Location:3WTCAdditional Locations :Job Posting Start Date2024-03-13Salary RangeMinimum Salary:$82847.4375Maximum Salary$138079.0625At Diageo certain roles are eligible for additional rewards, including annual incentive payment and stock awards. US-based employees are eligible for healthcare benefits, retirement benefits , short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, wellness benefits and industry leading parental leave, among others. (Benefits/perks listed may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Diageo and the country where you work.) The salary range displayed is the salary range for the role’s primary location.

For consideration candidates must live in a major US city to have the ability to travel All over the world, Kärcher is synonymous with top performance, innovation and quality. In the same way that our products stand out from others, we too stand out as an employer. As a family-owned company, mutual appreciation and trust are particularly important to us. At Kärcher you can expect extraordinary tasks, which is why we look for employees who show outstanding motivation, dedication, and team spirit. Only together can we create that which sets Kärcher apart – and each individual employee plays an important role in this. The difference is you. PURPOSEAs a National Account Manager you will be responsible for account management and calling on Corporate Accounts to identify and prioritize our best opportunities. Offer creative solution packages for the cleaning needs of Corporate Accounts and work in cooperation with our Brand VPs and dealers as needed. Identify and the pursue the most profitable growth opportunities and market segments while working with the Senior VP to establish pricing. GENERAL ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES• Responsible for managing National Account relationships within TG, with focus on direct sales strategy• Determine strategic value in developing into Key Account• Accountable for Revenue, Gross Margin and growth• Prepare and negotiate national agreements, focused on solution selling approach with equipment, chemicals, parts and service• Engage and support opportunities with regional BDMs, RSMs & IRSMs• Provide product and process training to customers• Recommend and implement targeted marketing and promotion programs and actively participate in the planning and evaluation process with marketing management to develop effective promotion activity within assigned markets.QUALIFICATIONSEducation· Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) from a four-year college or university or equivalent experienceExperience3-5 years of work experience as a national account managerExcellent knowledge of sale analysis and metricsKnowledge, Skills and AbilitiesTranslates the leadership culture of Kärcher into day-to-day activities and behaviorDemonstrates a high level of people orientation and respect towards othersBuild and maintain long-term relationships with key customersAbility to adapt to stretch goals and continuous improvement company cultureAbility to work in a collaborative method with other divisions to accomplish goals and objectives.Solid account management skillsInforms others in time and in a comprehensive and understandable manner. Ability to think and act independently within a fast-paced multi-task driven environmentAnalyzes data and information in an effective and efficient wayLooks for new challenges and development opportunitiesEffectively prioritizes, organizes and carries out tasks in process-oriented mannerDetail oriented, highly organized, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environmentProficient communication skills (verbal, oral, and written)Proven ability to build trusted relationships with colleagues, start-ups and other partnersMotivates and empowers others in an effective way

This position is in support of Global Sustainment (GS) product design and delivery for RMS-C6ISR programs in Valley Forge, PA. The successful candidate will support development of all tasks associated with technical publications (TP) and training, with a focus on training development and conduct. The position requires that the hiring candidate writes, rewrites, and/or edits training materials as well as technical documents such as technical procedure manuals, user manuals, and related technical documents to communicate clearly and effectively technical specifications and instructions to a wide range of audiences. The person selected for this position must acquire subject knowledge through familiarization of the system(s) through hands-on operation and by interviewing product developers and referring to technical specifications, blueprints, and engineering illustrations. The successful candidate shall also develop, and present instructional materials and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, development of instructor led training and course content, identifying student learning objectives, preparation of course syllabi, lesson plans, testing, development of student manuals and the evaluation and quality assurance of training materials and procedures. The candidate must be familiar with identifying required engineering source data and incorporating approved information into support products.This position requires basic knowledge of computer hardware, networking, and maintenance processes. The candidate will provide Subject Matter Expert (SME) support during formal training courses. The candidate will develop training material specific to the program, which will be used for official training and periodic training refreshers. Selected candidate must be a confident public speaker and have excellent written communications skills. Candidate must be able to interface with customer representatives and leadership as well as LM Program leadership. Applicant selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Position: Assistant Project ManagerLocation: Kansas CityCompensation: $60,000 - $85,000 Industry: Steel – Commercial Construction The PositionAre you looking to take the leap into to the construction industry?The CompanyA family owned commercial construction company in the heart of Kansas City!Job Summary:Assisting the project manager, ensuring that projects are completed within the correct timeframe and within budget  Responsibilities/Duties:Understand construction processResponsible for profit/loss for assigned projectsResponsible for change management, estimating & change ordersProviding technical assistanceAccountable for the staffing of the projectsRequirements:Some understanding of the construction industryWilling to learn the company methods of project managementAbility to work under a senior project managerAbility to take on tasks and meet deadlines set by the project manager  Benefits:Full health, dental, and life insuranceRetirement planBonus How to applyPlease submit your application via the contact details provided and you will be contacted with further information about this opportunity.

Company DescriptionEstablished in 2013, MedTrainer is the healthtech leader accelerating compliance with a unified digital platform that optimizes workflows and streamlines education, credentialing, and documentation. Backed by Telescope Partners and Vista Equity Partners, MedTrainer helps busy healthcare professionals operate with complete visibility and enhanced organization across all compliance areas. Over 300,000 healthcare professionals across 15,000 healthcare sites in North America rely on MedTrainer to get more done in less time. Learn more at medtrainer.com.Job DescriptionThe Customer Success leader is responsible for building, owning and managing the customer experience post-sale. This leader defines and executes on a strategy that drives customer retention and drives revenue growth with existing customers. Success will be achieved through defining systems and processes and building a high performing team that is responsible for onboarding, adoption, customer support, retention, upselling and escalation management. The Customer Success Leader will manage the customer success team in a way that combines the customers’ goals with the business’s goals to form a cohesive, data-led, and customer-informed process.The ideal candidate will have extensive customer success experience building and managing teams at a high growth SaaS business. The leader should have the ability to scale the department assuming revenue growth from approximately $30M in ARR to $75M in ARR. This is a hands-on role that requires building, managing, improving and scaling the operations over time and growing to a VP-level contributor.Key Responsibilities:Leading the customer success team, from building the department to developing it for scalability and sustained growth, with all the people, processes, and strategies.Creating an optimized & data-led model of the customer journey, then making sure all internal stakeholders are aligned to it. Driving CS Ops team to deploy systems and build processes that provide leverage for customer success managers so that they can be highly efficient and effective in their daily activities. Determining the metrics, health scores, and KPIs relevant to each account, the entire team, and the entire business. Determine approach and operationalize how to track and report on these metrics at the team, department and company level.Increasing product adoption, customer loyalty and retention, and customer satisfaction while actively setting and contributing to churn reduction tactics.Collaborating with sales and marketing to create and optimize the upsell and cross-sell strategies the CS team uses to increase ROI.Drafting, approving, and implementing compensation plans for the entire CS team with the goal of encouraging effectiveness and performance and rewarding business objectives (i.e. churn reduction and upselling).Collaborating with the product team to resolve customer issues while also identifying and communicating platform improvements to minimize customer churn and maximize value received by the customer.QualificationsMinimum 5 years of experience working in Customer Success leading a customer success team with proven performance and specific revenue goal achievement as well as managing customer success operations.Process mindset and ability to define, manage, improve and control processes. Six-sigma and/or LEAN experience is a plus.Hands on attitude and ability to drive productivity but also be productive.Deep understanding of software businesses, with knowledge of both the subscription and renewal models. Expert communication skills and the ability to hold C-level customer conversations in difficult situations always working towards a mutually beneficial outcome.Business development knowledge and, ideally, experience in a high growth environment.Strong analytical and goal-oriented mindset backed by expert-level project management knowledge and skillset.Advanced business experience and ability to create strategies, guidelines, and objectives and implement them while driving business growth and creating data-driven reports.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

About TwineWe're a thriving ecosystem of top-tier freelancers from around the world. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups, Twine is the go-to platform for mission-critical projects. Twine's experts get to participate in generating quality datasets at an unprecedented scale. With over half a million registered freelancers and a growing roster of 35,000+ companies, we've become the comprehensive solution for freelancing.Our MissionAt Twine, we recognise that companies require a flexible approach to hiring expert freelancers for their most critical projects. Traditional freelance platforms often fall short when it comes to scalability and diversity. That's where we shine. Twine operates as a thriving global freelance network, with diverse experts across various fields, including marketing, engineering, and AI. Our core mission is to empower creators, whether they're businesses or individual freelancers, to thrive in their creative endeavours.About The RoleWe are seeking a UI/UX Designer for a leading IT consulting firm. The ideal candidate should have a Bachelor’s degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field with proven experience as a UI/UX Designer. Proficiency in Axure RP and Figma is required for wireframing and prototyping. Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and excellent communication skills are necessary for collaborating on UI/UX projects.Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field. Proven experience as a UI/UX Designer with a portfolio showcasing relevant work. Proficiency in Axure RP for wireframing and prototyping. Experience with Figma for designing and collaborating on UI/UX projects. Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. IT: 9 years, UI/UX Designer: 5 years, Figma: 3 years, and Axure: 2 years of experience preferred. Must be able to relocate to Dallas, TX 75201 before starting work. Able to work in-person.

Remote - Required to be within the state of Texasplease submit an updated resume (make sure the asking skills are added to the most recent projects - Refer to the Skill matrix). RTR, skill matrix - number of years with each asking technology, and three references (refer to the forms), two of them must be supervisor level references, and provide Full name, email and phone number of the references. Please provide the forms in word format only.Client requires the services of 1 Instructor Trainer 3, hereafter referred to as Candidate(s), who meets the general qualifications of Instructor Trainer 3, Technical Services, Help Desk and Operations and the specifications outlined in this document for the Client .Responsible for preparing, conducting, and evaluating technical training programs. Writes literature and materials to be used in programs and designs exercises to enhance lectures. Shall deliver on-site and web-based training courses covering any number of software solutions. Leads development of infrastructure for information delivery, as well as taking part in the writing and maintenance of training material and supplementary technical documentation. Creates instructor materials (course outlines, background material, instructional materials, and training aids), as needed for different COTS Products/Current IT-Driven in-house solutions as well as desktop support processes, i.e. Remote Access Systems, RAS step by step procedure. Assists with formatting training materials created by other DIR Staff as requested. Determines needs and develops plans to meet the need of customers. Assists in design of computer-based and multimedia curriculum. Shall be planning, directing and undertaking classroom training, electronic learning, multimedia programs, and other computer-aided instructional technologies, simulators, conferences and workshops. The trainer will manage the training program in accordance with business needs, regulatory requirements, and Quality Management System. Help staff with their productivity reporting both within and without the agency. Researches and recommends vendors and costs for various training methods including: training classes from outside vendors; books; readymade training guides; computer or web based training. Stay current with developments in computer training field, especially alternative media/methods for instruction. This instructor uses a computer to organize and draft a curriculum that breaks a complex subject into blocks or units of instruction, creates graphics, and integrates them into curriculum. Courses may be instructor based, computer-based, simulator based, interactive, or non-interactive. This instructor also teaches short technical courses in accordance with approved curriculum to maintain proficiency and to evaluate and develop new instructional techniques/courses. Job duties also include the following: incorporation of new curriculum in the teaching process (e.g., develops clarification or examples of application related to the subject matter), development and maintenance of classroom techniques that reflect professionalism and good discipline and enhance teaching, development of alternative teaching techniques and scenarios to maintain high motivation and interest in the subject areas, and while acting as the testing officer, the conducting of test analysis and development or revision of test items.-The Training Specialist is primarily responsible for working with a team of Training Specialist in technical and system curriculum delivery, revision and maintenance. This specialist will gather, analyze, translate and compose technical information into clear, readable materials to be used by technical and non-technical personnel. Collect data and analyze audiences and training needs, based on new business processes and policies, and apply these into successful training delivery. This specialist will teach technical courses in accordance with approved curriculum to maintain proficiency and to evaluate and develop new instructional techniques/courses. Has a basic understanding of EIR Accessibility and assistive technologies used by people with disabilities. Understands protocols for communicating with customers requiring special assistance to obtain required or requested information.Client requires the services of a Training Curriculum Developer who meets the general qualifications of DIR Instructor Trainer 3. The Training Curriculum Developer will be part of a dedicated PeopleSoft Financials upgrade project team.The core duties include designing training content for system users, support staff, and trainers, conducting training sessions, and developing various job aids. Additional duties include other project activities as needs arise in documentation and system testing.Must demonstrate and excel in communicating and working with a diverse team with collaboration tools competently in a remote work environment. Also, must be able to estimate work, set deadlines, and communicate effectively.

Junior Quality Assurance Tester - onsite Job, 1+ Year ExperienceAnnual Income: $55K - $65KA valid work permit is necessary in the US.About us: Patterned Learning is a platform that aims to help developers code faster and more efficiently. It offers features such as collaborative coding, real-time multiplayer editing, and the ability to build, test, and deploy directly from the browser. The platform also provides tightly integrated code generation, editing, and output capabilities.Overview:You will be responsible for ensuring the product is in pristine condition, creating test cases, ensuring the requirements are fully implemented, proposing improvement points, and analyzing whether the features and the products can solve the user’s needs.Requirements:Good problem-solving skills. Loves to play and find loopholes in a game/app. Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes. Proven ability to employ analytical thinking to solve problems and generate solutions. Ability to troubleshoot and think out of the box. Proven ability to collaborate in a multicultural team. Ability to remain focused in a team-oriented environment. Ability and willingness to keep learning. Ability to use software tools such as Git-lab, Word Processor, Spreadsheet, and Web Browser. Knowledge of modern education systems and development fields is desirable. Good verbal and written communication skills (Required language: English) Educational Background:Has a Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, computer engineering, or a similar major. Experience writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test strategies, plans, and cases. Understand the difference between white-box, Trey-box, and black-box testing. Proven work experience in software quality assurance. Proven work experience in the game industry. Experience with automated testing tools. Understanding of basic user experience design patterns – such as button placement, screen space use, hot zones, critical paths, and color pallets. Experience writing automated UI testing scenarios using Selenium or equivalent frameworks. Tasks:Writing test plans and creating test cases for the products. Collaborate with other QA Testers and developers to develop strategies and an effective test plan. Run test cases and analyze the results. Report bugs and errors to the development team in detail. Propose improvement points that will ease the user experience. Help solve problems faced by users and propose ideas to bypass errors. Work with cross-division teams to ensure quality throughout the software development cycle. Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet users’ needs. BenefitsWorking remotely with an international team Healthcare Internet package incentive Why Patterned Learning LLC?Patterned Learning can provide intelligent suggestions, automate repetitive tasks, and assist developers in writing code more effectively. This can help reduce coding errors, improve productivity, and accelerate the development process.Pattern recognition is particularly relevant in the context of coding. Neural networks, especially deep learning models, are commonly employed for pattern detection and classification tasks. These models simulate human decision-making and can identify patterns in data, making them well-suited for tasks like code analysis and generation.

If all apply please email info@wyldblue.store with the subject line: "Chief Operating Officer Application "to apply. Only emailed in applications will be considered. Thank you!The Chief Operating Officer (COO) will be responsible for overseeing and optimizing all aspects of our retail operations. This role will play a critical part in developing and executing strategies to enhance efficiency, productivity, and profitability across our stores and online platforms. The COO will collaborate closely with other members of the executive team to align operational initiatives with the overall business objectives.Key Responsibilities:Operational Strategy: Develop and implement comprehensive operational strategies to drive business growth and achieve organizational goals.Retail Operations Management: Oversee the day-to-day operations of our retail stores, ensuring smooth and efficient functioning, including inventory management, staffing, customer service, and sales performance.Supply Chain Management: Optimize the supply chain processes, including sourcing, procurement, logistics, and distribution, to improve efficiency and reduce costs.E-commerce Operations: Lead the development and execution of strategies to enhance our online presence, improve the user experience, and drive online sales.Performance Monitoring: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to monitor the performance of retail operations and identify areas for improvement.Budgeting and Cost Management: Develop and manage operational budgets, analyze variances, and implement cost-control measures to ensure financial targets are met.Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements and industry standards, as well as implement risk mitigation strategies to safeguard the business.Team Leadership: Build and lead a high-performing operational team, providing guidance, coaching, and mentorship to drive employee engagement and development.Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments, including marketing, finance, and human resources, to align operational initiatives with broader business strategies.Continuous Improvement: Promote a culture of continuous improvement and innovation, fostering creativity and efficiency in all aspects of retail operations.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in business administration, operations management, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.Proven experience in retail operations management, with a minimum of 8-10 years of progressive leadership roles in the retail industry.Strong understanding of retail operations, including supply chain management, inventory control, e-commerce, and customer service.Demonstrated ability to develop and execute operational strategies that drive business growth and improve profitability.Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams to achieve results.Strategic thinker with strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.

Company SummaryAs the recognized global standard for project-based businesses, Deltek delivers software and information solutions to help organizations achieve their purpose. Our market leadership stems from the work of our diverse employees who are united by a passion for learning, growing and making a difference. At Deltek, we take immense pride in creating a balanced, values-driven environment, where every employee feels included and empowered to do their best work. Our employees put our core values into action daily, creating a one-of-a-kind culture that has been recognized globally. Thanks to our incredible team, Deltek has been named one of America's Best Midsize Employers by Forbes, a Best Place to Work by Glassdoor, a Top Workplace by The Washington Post and a Best Place to Work in Asia by World HRD Congress. www.deltek.comBusiness SummaryDeltek’s award winning Support Services team provides best-in-class assistance to Deltek’s customers across the world via phone, chat and email. Our team is comprised of a group of diverse, collaborative and passionate professionals who come from varying industries, backgrounds and professions. Our diversity and passion is our strength, so however you identify and whatever background you bring, we invite you to explore our team as a potential next step in your career!Position ResponsibilitiesAs an Onboarding Success Manager at Deltek, you will work with our new and existing customers to ensure the successful implementation of Deltek’s industry-leading GovWin IQ software. Our Onboarding Success Manager’s achieve this through understanding customer business goals and objectives, developing strong rapport, and executing against a defined onboarding schedule. As the first touch point in a customer’s experience after purchasing GovWin IQ, you will be a critical player in driving long-term customer success and demonstrating the value.To be successful in this role, the Onboarding Success Manager will work across departments, including Sales, Product and Customer Success, bringing customer objectives to fruition through cross-departmental collaboration and communication. The ideal candidate has experience in SaaS and the architecture, engineering and construction industry, strong communication skills and attention to detail, with an outstanding aptitude for applying technology to achieve business results.This role manages a new customer and existing customer onboarding queue and ensure customer requests are addressed appropriately. The onboarding process manages all client communication, conducts ongoing training and office hour sessions, and support for clients. The Onboarding Success Manager will be responsible for onboarding new clients, training large groups of clients, proactive outreach and answering Tier I support questions when possible.Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Coordinates and executes onboarding related activities for clients Provides the initial outreach, where applicable, which outlines the setup process and where to find training and support resources Manages new client onboarding via email, phone and web-based tools Manages configurations and setups in relevant Deltek applications Trains operators/clients on processes as needed Develop and provide onboarding related trainings Provides Tier I phone and email technical expertise on applications when possibleTracks onboarding tasks against a schedule and coordinate with internal staff to ensure goals are met on a timely basis Provides quality and timely responses/actions onboarding activities Works with Development Team, as needed, to resolve issues Responsible for managing workload and communicating any backups as needed Provides ongoing feedback to the onboarding team manager on ways to improve client onboarding success Performs other activities as requested. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee incumbent in this position. Employee will be required to follow any other job related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. QualificationsBachelor’s Degree1+ year related in GovCon Industry 2+ years Customer Service experience Proficiency required in PC applications for project management, word processing, spreadsheets and presentations Knowledge of Gainsight and webinar softwareKnowledge of database and internet based software Excellent communication skills and proven track record of customer satisfaction Previous training experience; Proven ability to train and engage clients in training settings Previous experience in contributing to process development and improvement discussions Ability to manage multiple tasks in high pressure situations Ability to contribute/manage client discussions on multiple topics Ability to manage client relationships as a single point of contact Ability to learn new skills with little guidance to meet client needs Ability to thrive and collaborate in a team environment Travel Requirements10%EEO StatementDeltek, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.E-Verify StatementDeltek, Inc., utilizes the E-Verify program with every potential new hire. This makes it possible for us to make certain that every employee who works for Deltek is eligible to work in the United States. To learn more about E-Verify you can call 1-800-255-7688 or visit their website by clicking the logo below. E-Verify® is a registered trademark of the United States Department of Homeland Security.Applicant Privacy NoticeDeltek is committed to the protection and promotion of your privacy. In connection with your application for employment with us at Deltek, it is necessary for us to collect, store and use information about you (“Personal Data”) to administer and evaluate your application. We are the “controller” of the Personal Data you provide us and will process any such Personal Data in accordance with applicable law and the statements contained in this Employment Candidate Privacy Notice . Additionally, we have not sold and do not sell Personal Data you provide to us through the job application process.

***Please note this position is for a client of Frederickson Partners. This post is not for a position at Frederickson Partners, a Gallagher Company***Company: Gowan CompanyLocation: Yuma, Arizona with Global OversightAbout Gowan: Gowan Group is a global, family-owned agriculture solutions business headquartered in Yuma, AZ, U.S.A. Gowan specializes in developing, marketing, and manufacturing global agriculture inputs such as crop protection products, seeds, and fertilizers. Today, Gowan has over 45 entities in 19 countries and sales in over 70 countries. Across the world, the Gowan Tribe strives to understand the needs of local markets and provide solutions to critical pest problems. Position Summary:Gowan seeks a dynamic and visionary Global Head of People to lead Gowan's Human Resources (HR) department and play a key role in shaping and executing HR strategies that align with the company's values and strategic objectives. As a critical member of the leadership team, this role is instrumental in driving key company-wide initiatives, contributing significantly to growth and success by nurturing a skilled, motivated, and collaborative workforce. The leader will oversee global HR staff in Gowan Company’s headquarters and lead HR managers in multiple international offices.At Gowan, you'd be part of a collective mission to revolutionize farming, enhancing crop health, and contributing to food security of a growing global population. Key Accountabilities:HR Budget Management and Planning:Manage the global HR budget and collaborate with managers to secure appropriate allocation for compensation, new hires, development, and relocation.Evaluate and develop the company's compensation benchmarking and benefits program to ensure cost-effectiveness.Employee Relations and Performance Management:Oversee workers' compensation, risk management, and health insurance issues.Work with the Strategic Development Director to provide a framework for succession planning, employee development, and performance optimization to improve employee retention and satisfaction.Support global manufacturing plant managers in training initiatives and safety compliance.Create a culture of accountability through performance management processes.Talent Recruitment and Onboarding: Collaborate with country and department managers, along with the Global Recruitment Manager, to identify strategic talent needs and improve the immediate and long-term recruitment strategy. Streamline and improve onboarding programs for new hires at all levels.Implement a systemized plan for rewarding top-performing employees.Leadership Development and Culture Building:Work with the Organizational Development Manager and Strategic Development Director to create a toolbox and training program for Gowan managers to help them attain optimum leadership effectiveness. This will include recruitment, interviewing, and vetting best practices, new employee experience, performance accountability (through PIPs, performance management, and terminations), recognition, and training and development of staff.Implement initiatives to scale the culture of Gowan Company to benefit employees across all geographies and levels. Communication and Reporting:Coordinate with key leaders on communications to global staff regarding HR policies and organizational announcements, including crisis communications.Provide analytics and updates on HR strategy, initiatives, and challenges to the CEO and Board of Directors.

Want to help us, help others? We’re hiring!GoFundMe is a global community of over 100 million people with the common purpose of helping one another. Our mission is to help people help each other by making it safe and easy for people to ask for help and support causes—for themselves, each other, and their communities. In 2022, GoFundMe joined together with Classy, a leading nonprofit fundraising software company that enables nonprofits to connect supporters with the causes they care about. Together, GoFundMe and Classy have empowered people and organizations to raise more than $25 billion since 2010. Our vision is to become the most helpful place in the world.Join us! The GoFundMe is looking for a dedicated Marketing Content Coordinator to take the helm of our content management and coordination efforts. This role is vital for streamlining our content creation process, ensuring consistency across our platforms, and maintaining the integrity of our brand messaging. As the central hub for all content-related activities, this position addresses the challenges posed by the current decentralized access and management of content within the WordPress platform.The ideal candidate will bring a blend of technical skills, creativity, and organizational prowess to elevate our content strategy and execution.The Job…Content Strategy and Management: Support the marketing team by developing and implementing content strategies, creating and distributing high-quality content, and performing ongoing content analysis.Stakeholder Engagement: Build and maintain strong relationships with peers, clients, and stakeholders to ensure alignment and support for content initiatives.Content Audits: Conduct comprehensive audits of owned digital properties to identify areas for improvement and new content opportunities.Optimization and Localization: Work with our localization team to ensure content is optimized for different platforms and locales, enhancing reach and engagement.Content Scheduling: Maintain content calendars, ensuring timely creation, approval, and publication of content across channels.Brand Consistency: Work closely with internal marketing teams to guarantee that all content aligns with GoFundMe's brand voice and standards.You are…Proficient with the WordPress ecosystem.Keen attention to detail.Strong multitasking abilities.Basic knowledge of HTML and CSS for content formatting and troubleshooting.We would like to see…Experience with WordPress multisite configurations.Familiarity with the Smartling Translation Manager Plugin for content localization.A degree or equivalent experience in English, Writing, or a related field to enhance content quality and coherence.Why you’ll love it here...Market competitive payRich healthcare benefits including employer paid premiums for medical/dental/vision (100% for employee only plans and 85% for employee + dependent plans) and employer HSA contributions. 401(k) retirement plan with company matchingHybrid workplace with fully remote flexibility for many rolesMonetary support for new hire setup, hybrid work & wellbeing, family planning, and commuting expensesA variety of mental and wellness programs to support employees Generous paid parental leave and family planning stipendSupportive time off policies including vacation, sick/mental health days, volunteer days, company holidays, and a floating holidayLearning & development and recognition programsGives Back Program where employees can nominate a fundraiser every week for a donation from the companyInclusion, diversity, equity, and belonging are vital to our priorities and we continue to evolve our strategy to ensure DEI is embedded in all processes and programs at GoFundMe. Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion team is always finding new ways for our company to uphold and represent the experiences of all of the people in our organization.Employee resource groupsYour work has a real purpose and will help change lives on a global scale.You’ll be a part of a fun, supportive team that works hard and celebrates accomplishments together. We live by our core values: impatient to be great, find a way, earn trust every day, fueled by purposeWe are a certified Great Place to Work, are growing fast and have incredible opportunities ahead!GoFundMe is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that actively pursues candidates of diverse backgrounds and experiences. We are committed to providing diversity, equity, and inclusion training to all employees, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, ethnicity, nationality or national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, age, medical condition, mental or physical disability, or military or veteran status.The total annual salary for this full-time position is $65,000 - $85,000 + equity + benefits. As this is a remote position, the salary range was determined by role, level, and possible location across the US. Individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range based on your location during the hiring process.If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete a job application or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please contact us at accommodationrequests@gofundme.com.Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants:Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) or certain US privacy laws may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Chinese Alliance Church of Westchester (CACW) is a Christian and Missionary Alliance Church located in Port Chester, NY. We are made up of a community of believers seeking to love God and others. We are a Chinese and English speaking church with 2 congregations and a combined total of about 150 attendees. We are currently seeking a Youth Minister to join our pastoral team to support the youth ministry.ResponsibilitiesMentor and disciple the Youth Ministry personally and spiritually. Plan, coordinate, and lead weekly youth group, Sunday school, Bible studies, and various other events such as short-term mission trips and community outreach. Teach and exemplify Biblical precepts and concepts to youths in grades 6th to 12th in weekly youth group and youth Sunday school meetings for approximately 15-20 teenagers. Participate in other church-related events (such as occasional preaching, Vacation Bible School, Children’s church, church picnic, and other community outreach events). Work with the pastoral staff and governing board to plan, pray, and coordinate various ministries within the church. QualificationsPassion for God: Born-again Christian, who believes in the infallibility of the Bible and is willing to abide by the doctrines and traditions of the Christian and Missionary Alliance church denomination. Passion to work with youth and cross-cultural ministry. Youth Ministry experience (preferred). Minimum of a bachelor’s degree, preferably from an accredited academic Bible college or equivalent. Ministry focus preferred; completion of pursuit of a relevant Masters degree a plus. Agreement with the Christian and Missionary Alliance statement of faith with the intent of obtaining C&MA licensing. Fluency in Spanish is a plus to support our current neighborhood outreach. Community Outreach OpportunitiesHelp with the church’s bi-weekly food pantry to the community in Port Chester. Continue and develop our after school program. Connect with the families and youth from our community. To be considered for this position, please complete the application to include your testimony, resume and other background information related to the position.If the district office has reviewed your application and they think you may be a potential match for the position, that the hiring manager will reach out to you for next steps.This position may require licensing with The Christian & Missionary Alliance. To learn more about The Alliance and requirements for licensing, please visit our websitePlease do not contact the church directly.

Job Description – Supply Chain AnalystSummaryArchaea Energy, a bp company, is one of the largest renewable natural gas (“RNG”) producers in the U.S., with an industry leading RNG platform and expertise in developing, constructing, and operating RNG facilities to capture waste emissions and convert them into low carbon fuel. The Supply Chain Analyst plays a crucial role in ensuring that a company’s supply meets demand efficiently. This individual would assist in monitoring the flow of information, resources, and data required by supply chain to ensure that critical processes are run effectively and to achieve organizational goals. This role will report to the Director of Supply Chain & Procurement. The position will be hybrid and located in Houston or Pittsburgh.   Job Duties and Responsibilities Collect and manage data on supply chain operations.Analyze this data to identify areas for improving supply chain efficiency.Develop and execute projects aimed at enhancing supply chain operations.Establish and maintain relationships with shippers and vendors.Measure supply chain performance and report findings to management.Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to enhance service delivery.Interpret data and analyzing results using statistical techniques.Gather and analyze company spend, supply market data, and other commercial information.Develop sourcing and negotiation strategies.Monitor and evaluate supply risks.Support Supplier Performance Management Job Specific Competencies Safety (displays strong commitment to safety and completes safety training)Productivity (completes work in a timely manner)Quality (gets the job done correctly)Initiative (completes work with minimum supervision and seeks new and better methods to do the job)Dependability (shows up to work and responds promptly to all call outs)Attendance (employee’s record for being at work regularly and on time)Communication (effectively communicates with team members and management)Teamwork (works effectively with team, management and customers)Customer focus (consistently focuses on the customer)Ethics, Integrity and Character (treats people honestly and with respect) Skills, Experience RequiredRequires a college degree in business, engineering, or supply chain. 0-2 years of experience preferred.Experience for this role typically obtained through internships, part time roles or entry level positions. Experience using Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, and working knowledge of an ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning Software).Technical mindset to learn systems and the LFG business.Ability to deal with customers throughout the organization and at all levels.Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).Ability to problem solve.Ability to quickly adapt to change.Strong Excel and other data management skills.Strong project management and organization skills.Possess knowledge of various types of engine/mechanical and electrical parts.Experience reading Blueprints.Must possess a valid driver’s license.Pre-employment drug test and background check required.  -----Archaea Energy is a bp company. bp is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.  If you are a US-based applicant or you are applying to a position in the US and you are an individual with disability or a disabled veteran, and would like any type of assistance to apply or to access or to attend any recruitment or selection event, system or process, we would like to help you to ensure that your application process goes as smoothly as possible. If you need assistance, information or answers to your questions, feel free to contact us or have any of your representatives contact us at humanresources@archaea.energy.
