Regional Vice PresidentFLSA-EHave experience as a regional director or vice president of therapy operations, but looking for a new opportunity? Be part of a paradigm-shifting model that offers skilled-nursing facilities a unique and different kind of relationship through our In-House Therapy Alliance, and join Seagrove Rehab Partners as a Regional Vice President. The Regional Vice President serves in a consultant-like role to assigned facilities, and is responsible for evaluating therapy programs, services, and personnel, as well as providing monthly oversight, operations management, and compliance support. You’ll get to equip and motivate teams, and serve as an educational resource to clients and a mentor to rehab managers. The ideal candidate is an effective multi-site operations professional with the ability to translate complex material into useful knowledge and tools for optimizing rehab operations, enhancing organizations’ success, and delivering excellent patient outcomes. The Regional VP ensures quality rehabilitation services are delivered at partner facilities in accordance with all applicable laws, regulations, and practice guidelines. In addition, the Regional VP serves as a key member of our leadership team, collaborating on strategic planning and development of company goals, cultivating relationships with client partners, and supporting business development efforts to target audiences. About Seagrove Rehab PartnersOur mission is to serve the therapy industry by providing a compassionate, people-centered approach to compliance and management support, including a proprietary solution for in-house therapy programs. We believe that our In-House Therapy Alliance not only helps our partners to be more compliant and profitable, but also puts the patient first. Mark McDavid, president, and our company associates are available to work with skilled nursing facilities, rehab agencies, and other healthcare providers at the client site, by phone, by email, by video conference call and through workshops and seminars. If you are interested, please see our full listing at: www.seagroverehab.com/careers

About The SuiteWe build high-quality and highly-curated professional communities. We run three such communities today, including our flagship TechGC, which is a private, invite-only community for General Counsels & CLOs of high-growth tech companies and venture funds. We also run DeputyGC (for Deputy General Counsels & Associate General Counsels) and The F Suite (for CFOs), with more to come. Each of our communities is unique, but they are all powered by our custom-built platform which our members like to call “the Braintrust.”We currently have 4,600+ paid members across our communities, representing C-Suite executives from many of today’s leading tech companies (e.g., Airbnb, Slack, Coinbase, Uber, Notion, Bolt, Figma, Airtable, Dropbox, etc.) and venture funds (e.g., a16z, Softbank, Tiger, Accel, Thrive, Battery Ventures, FirstMark, etc.). On the other side of our communities, we have built deep partnerships with the top law firms (e.g., Latham, Cooley, WSGR, Fenwick, Goodwin, S&C, Davis Polk, etc.), legal/fintech vendors (e.g., Ironclad, LinkSquares, DataGrail, Lawtrades, Morgan Stanley at Work, NPM, SpendFlo, etc.), and professional service providers (e.g., Aon, Deloitte, EY, Franklin Square Group, Marsh, Newfront, etc.) that support these executives. These partners engage with our members as thought leaders and valued advisors/resources, and we foster a unique environment where the two sides of our ecosystem can connect through targeted education, networking, and support. Our mission is to help today’s leaders excel in their day-to-day jobs and succeed throughout their careers. One of the core ways we are able to do that is by connecting our members to the right advisors/tools at the right time.We are a well-funded and rapidly scaling startup with a high-impact team of over 50 people.About The F SuiteF Suite is an independent, invitation-only community platform for Chief Financial Officers of leading high-growth companies and venture capital firms. Our mission is to help our members do their day-to-day jobs better and excel throughout their careers.We have 600+ members around the country, with formal chapters in Boston, Chicago, New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, and Seattle. We host 100+ private events throughout the year across the United States and virtually.About the JobWe are seeking a dynamic and organized Event Associate to join our team and contribute to the successful planning and execution of our event program. The ideal candidate should possess a passion for event management, excellent communication skills, and a keen eye for detail. As an Event Associate, you will play a crucial role in supporting the planning, coordination, and implementation of our dinner events and virtual sessions, ensuring they run smoothly and leave a lasting impression on our members.Our ideal candidate has experience in the finance and/or startup industries, has intense innate curiosity, a passion for planning, and desire to produce the best experiences in the industry. The right candidate will enjoy coordinating multiple events at a time and optimizing processes. We are known for our event experiences, so this is an incredible opportunity for someone who loves events, educational content, startups and finance.Responsibilities:Attendee Curation: Using your knowledge of the tech ecosystem, curate our invite and attendee lists to connect members with their closest peersEvent Coordination: Assist in the planning and coordination of our private dinners and virtual events from start to finish. Collaborate with the Director of Events, Director of Content and Program Director to ensure all aspects of the event are well-organized and executed flawlessly. Event Marketing: Own the creation and maintenance for all event landing pages for private dinners and virtual events.Attendee Management: Oversee the entire invite process, from drafting attendee lists, invite language and follow up communication with members. Provide prompt and helpful responses to attendee questions and concerns before, during, and after events.On-Site Support: Provide on-site support during events, assisting with event setup, registration, managing event flow, and addressing any issues or emergencies that may arise.Administrative Tasks: Assist in administrative duties related to event planning, such as data entry, document preparation, and maintaining event records and databases.QualificationsYou're an excellent communicator and a strong, confident writer.You have incredible attention to detail. You notice when the correct brand color isn’t used and when tables are not set up as described on the floor plan.You’re a quick thinker and incredibly resourceful. Handling unexpected challenges and finding practical solutions during events is your specialty.You’re highly customer-service oriented and love building and maintaining relationships.You're extremely comfortable learning new technologies and have a passion for startups and financial communities.You enjoy learning new planning tools.You have strong administrative and organizational skills, and can easily multi-task, follow up and manage competing priorities all under tight deadlines.You're a self-starter, but when something is over your head you aren't afraid to ask for help.ExperienceB.A. or B.S. from an accredited college or universityDemonstrated interest in startups and community building2+ years experience leading events﻿BenefitsCompetitive salary of 80-90k and bonus opportunityFully-distributed team with a “work from anywhere” environment and flexible work scheduleBi-annual company gatheringsFlexible vacation policy + company shut down two weeks per yearQuality medical, dental, and vision insuranceLife insurance and disability benefitsFitness reimbursement (Peloton)401(k) planApple laptop equipment

This is a remote position. Junior Data Scientist (1 year experience, remote)Be part of our future! This job posting builds our talent pool for potential future openings. We'll compare your skills and experience. Against both current and future needs. If there's a match, we'll contact you directly. No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from the US/Canada residents during the application process. Hiring Type: Full-Time Base Salary: $59K-$69K Per Annum.Responsibilities:Partner with engineers, product managers, and business partners to identify algorithmic problems, brainstorm possible approaches, and recommend the best path forward. Develop algorithms iteratively, building in the right level of complexity to solve the business problem at hand and support future improvements. Define success criteria for your models so that you can measure impact and changes over time. You'll be expected to communicate findings and drive continuous improvements. Collaborate with Software Engineers to implement algorithms in production that scale gracefully. Collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize projects and define requirements. Carry out analysis of data produced by our hardware systems and create insightful visualizations to share your findings. Contribute to internal libraries to help other teams with their data science needs including visualization, prediction, optimization, and inference. Requirements & Experience:Advanced proficiency with Python and libraries commonly used for data analysis, e.g., Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, and Matplotlib. Strong understanding of data modeling and statistical analysis. Knowledge of optimization and predictive modeling techniques and experience applying them to real-world problems. Skilled at translating a general question or problem into a clearly defined algorithmic solution. Ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Nice to haves:1-year Experience with Data Bricks or PySpark 1 year Experience with product ionizing data models

column6: Quimbee has a massive library of content designed to help law students and attorneys succeed, every step of the way. Not only do we help law students succeed in law school and on the bar exam, but Quimbee is also equally committed to building a premier collection of courses designed to satisfy attorneys' MCLE requirements. Quimbee can be accessed on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. We are seeking experienced bar exam graders to help our law students pass the bar!This position is 100% remote. All you need is an internet connection and a quiet place to work.OverviewWe are looking for exceptional attorneys and legal educators who are passionate about providing feedback to law students on bar exam essays. This is a position of great trust and responsibility.Who We're Looking ForYou're a really smart lawyer. This means you have a JD from an accredited law school. You excelled in law school and aced the bar thereafter. You're the kind of person law students will respect receiving feedback from, and you thoroughly enjoy providing it to them.You're an exceptional legal writer. Ideally, you served on a law journal (law review would be even better). If you got something published, then that's extra points. You understand that less is more, details matter, and small words are better than big words.You're a detail-oriented self-starter: You're disciplined and motivated and the kind of person who doesn't need someone looking over your shoulder to make sure you're doing your job.RequirementsMinimum:A JD from an accredited U.S. law schoolMust be a licensed attorney, in good standing, in any Florida jurisdictionMust be comfortable working in a collaborative and remote team environmentPreferred:2 years of experience in the active practice and/or teaching of lawPast bar exam essay grading experienceBenefits100% remote$35 per essay

OFFICE / HR COORDINATORLOCATION: NYC - LESEMPLOYMENT STATUS: FULL TIMEDEPARTMENT: ADMINISTRATIVE REPORTS TO: HR DIRECTOR WITH DOTTED LINE TO EXECUTIVE ASSISTANTSALARY RANGE: $62,400 - $65,000 (DEPENDING ON EXPERIENCE)Founded in 2013, Fohr is an influencer marketing platform. We’ve built a self-serve platform that allows you to run the best influencer marketing campaigns imaginable. We run and manage campaigns from $25,000 to a million dollars, from one influencer to 4,000. We are currently seeking a full-time Office / HR Coordinator to join our dynamic team! This opportunity has a key role in supporting our Employees, HR Director, and the Executive Assistant. POSITION SUMMARY The Office / HR Coordinator, will be a hybrid role in which the majority of your focus will be about 65% focused on the Office Coordinator responsibilities and about 35% will focus on the HR Coordinator responsibilities. This can fluctuate based on business needs. You will perform diverse office duties and HR Coordinator functions requiring a high level of confidentiality, initiative, and sound decision-making. This role will report to the HR Director with a dotted line into the Executive Assistant. You would require experience within HR on an entry level, managing onboarding and HRIS system entry. This role can potentially grow into a full time HR role within 1 to 2 years, if there is an interest. You will rely on excellent organizational skills and the ability to effectively handle multiple priorities. You will need to adapt procedures, processes, and techniques to the completion of assignments. You will be working cross departmentally. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES Office Coordinator:Coordinate team wide calendars, events, office wide announcements (eg. holiday party, birthdays, office closures etc.)Manage office budget and prioritizing spending.Update and maintain a series of ongoing spreadsheets.Implement systems to streamline office operations and protocols.Coordinate employee life events, celebrations and achievements.Coordinate internal anniversary gifting - varsity jacket, pins, Rimowa coordination and production.Book employee travel for client visits.Office Upkeep:Manage all aspects of office space - decoration, organization, etc. Update visuals as needed. Coordinate with external vendors and building management in regards to any maintenance needs for HVAC, plumbing, electrical, garbage disposal, appliances, etc. Coordinate with third party contractors for any work to be done in the office.Coordinate weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual maintenance visits.Maintain close contact with building superintendent and management.Work with cleaners/day porters on daily routine and maintenance.Stock and organize supplies (office supplies, toiletries, refreshments, etc).Coordinate, organize and execute all Fohr events, both in office and off site. Eg. team celebrations events, off site workshops, client lunches, internal meetings.Welcome, greet, direct visitors and deliveries.Sorting correspondence and packages.Assist with client and holiday gifting - create fedex labels, boxing, shipping, handling, etc.  Assist Executive Assistant with any CEO needs and errands when need be.Hr Coordinator: Manage new hire onboarding - running it, updating the deck and partnering with IT with equipment. Ensuring new hires complete paperwork.Completion of verification of I-9s. Upkeep the HRIS system with employee data, we currently use Trinet. Upkeep Talent Review Platform with employee information, we currently use Culture Amp. Answer and manager tier one questions and assist with report requests.Assist HR Director with planning and executing of DEI events.Assist HR Director with sourcing resumes for open positions. EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & PERSONAL ATTRIBUTESOffice Coordinator:At least 2 years of prior experience.Tech Savvy. Great with multitasking. Ideal candidate has a background in a similar field.Extremely well organized, methodical and detailed oriented.Must be able to lift 50 lbs over their head and is confident using all tools within a standard toolbox kit. HR Coordinator:1-2 years of experience in an entry level HR role required.Would require at least 1 year of experience of resume sourcing.A degree or certification in HR is highly preferred.Must have onboarding and HRIS experience.Manage confidentiality within a high level. Overall:Tact and good judgment in confidential situations and proven experience interacting with leadership.Proficient knowledge of MS Word, Excel, Office Pro and Key Note.Proficient in G Suite related applications. (Drive, Docs, Sheets, etc).Experience with event coordination.PERKS & CULTURE Fohr offers a competitive salary and benefits package including:Medical, Dental, Vision, Long and Short-term Disability401K with matchingCommuter and Flex SpendingFlexible Vacation Pet friendly environmentUpbeat, stylish studio space with a bar in the officeSummer Fridays and one week winter office closerOur culture is rooted in internal and external partnership, collaboration, and respect.Our team of 90ish people is based in the Lower East Side of New York City. We love our work, we’re passionate about what we’re doing, and we aren’t afraid to try new things and have fun doing them. We hire people for the way their brains work, their drive, and their charisma.We also believe it’s time to reinvent the advertising industry, and the first step is a team that’s dedicated to the cause. FOHR VALUES Everything we do is rooted in our Fohr Values: Excellence – We strive not just for your best, but for a level right beyond that high mark.Individuality – We have a Fohr way of doing things / Thinking differently is in our DNA.Curiosity – We seek to understand the things we don’t agree with, we investigate ideas before discarding them and question the status quo instead of following it.Ownership - We are dependable and deliver on expectations.Camaraderie – We look to build meaningful relationships in the workplace.Optimism – We believe deeply in the potential of our colleagues and clients and give the support and encouragement needed to reach that potential.EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT Fohr is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local laws.

Job Title: Video Producer Department: Video ContentPosition: Full-time, permanent, salary plus benefitsLocation: NYC office // HybridExperience Desired: 2-4 years Description: Do you want to put your vast knowledge of random pop culture and online trends to use? Do you wish your endless TikTok scrolling counted as “research”? Do you seek external validation from strangers by putting yourself on the internet? Would you rather edit a video than write a cover letter? Then you may be perfect for this role at Betches. Betches Media is looking for a hilarious and highly skilled video producer to join the team and create some of the funniest videos on the internet. In this role, you will work directly with our content team and other team members to brainstorm, film, and edit social video across platforms, while staying attuned to trending topics, content, sounds, and more. The ideal candidate understands the Betches voice, but also comes with a unique perspective and sense of humor that helps us stand out even further. You should also genuinely enjoy diving into your FYP, finding new inspiration and ways to approach content. The ideal candidate is proficient in production, shooting and editing digital video content across all platforms, specifically Instagram and TikTok. You should be passionate about video production, comedy, and know and love the Betches brand and voice. This role will report to the Senior Video Director and work closely with our larger content team. Role & Responsibilities:Produce, shoot, edit and star in a variety of Betches Media videos (sketches, reels, videos, etc.)Ideate, script, and execute ad hoc and series ideas for Betches and Betches verticalsAssist in all aspects of the production process, including pitching, scripting, shooting, appearing in, and editing videos and video seriesCollaborate with video and content team to produce high quality video contentQualifications:2-4 years experience in producing, shooting & editing videos for socialMust be comfortable appearing/acting in videos as neededStrong interest and background in comedy requiredAbility to shoot and edit narrative sketchesStrong ability to produce and film quick social videos Proficiency in Adobe Premiere (knowledge of After Effects and other Adobe apps huge plus)Understanding of basic lighting techniques and DSLR camerasFluent in the culture of social mediaPast media experience a plusAbility to travel locally, if needed Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university preferred, but not required*Be sure to include a link to your portfolio or reel in your resume*Compensation:The expected annual base salary for this role is $65,000 - $75,000. Final offers for this role will be made within the parameters of the salary range provided. Years of experience, skills, and other factors such as location are considered when determining the salary offered. Total compensation and offer package will include the following perks below.Our Perks:Paid medical insuranceDental & vision insurance Paid vacation & holidays 401K & transit benefitsFlexible time offHalf day Fridays Paid parental leaveRemote work opportunitiesOngoing company outingsOpportunity for growth Fast-paced, high growth work environment Friendly, fun, creative and collaborative team-based work environment The Application: Apply directly on LinkedInBetches Media is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, disability, or length of time spent unemployed. We’re actively working to increase the diversity of experience and perspectives on our team, and we want to hear from you!BETCHES MEDIA LLC is an equal opportunity employer. The materials I submit to BETCHES MEDIA LLC as part of my application for employment (the “Application”) will not be used for limiting or excluding any applicant from consideration for employment on a basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law. The Director of Operations is a key member of the Senior Leadership Team. The Director of Operations will lead and mentor the Company operations leaders. The Director of Operations will work closely with the Executive Leadership Team and plan, coordinate, and oversee operations activities in the Company and EDP dental practices. The Director's work with result in optimized operations and identification and implementation of cost effective systems and solutions to meet the current and evolving needs of the organization.Director of Operations Job Responsibilities:• Collaborates with executive leadership to develop and meet company goals while supplying expertise and guidance on operations projects and systems• Establishes, implements, and communicates the strategic direction of the organization’s operations• Collaborates with other divisions and departments to carry out the organization’s goals and objectives• Oversees operational activities of the company• Develops, leads and mentors operational leaders• Ensures operations team leaders and their teams are properly trained• Responsible for ensuring operational leadership and their teams have easy electronic access to revenue cycle metrics relating to the centers. Responsible for ensuring we have metrics and goals to measure performance that are well communicated and administered.• Identifies, recommends, and implements cost effective processes, technologies, and systems to improve and streamline organizational processes and use of resources and materials• Ensures that departmental decisions and project plans such as those for staffing, development, organization, and facilities are in line with the organization’s business plan and vision• Establishes, communicates, and implements operations-related policies, practices, standards, and measures to ensure effective and consistent support and execution• Develop process and workflow messaging for the field, ensuring that all communications to the practices are understandable, accurate and consistent• Reviews and approves cost-control reports, cost estimates, and staffing requirements for projects• Collaborates with finance to establish operations and facilities budgets and administers the budgets• Presents periodic performance reports and metrics to the Executive Leadership Team and or the Board of Directors• Maintains knowledge of emerging technologies and trends in operations management• Performs other related duties as assignedIdeal Candidates will:• Be an effective team player who contributes valuable ideas and feedback and can be counted on to meet commitments• Be able to keep up in the Elite Dental Partners’ environment by facing tasks and challenges with positive energy• Pursue activities with focus and drive, defines work in terms of success, and can be counted on to complete goals.• Adhere to Company policies and standards of business conduct and compliance.• Provide clear direction to achieve goals, creating an environment that fosters team commitment and employee engagement.• Maintain the perseverance to drive necessary change and be resilient and flexible• Maintain regular communications with team members and be open to opinions and feedback• Create a work environment in which people are able to perform to the best of their abilities• Work to build employee morale and a professional, effective, and efficient working atmosphere• Be excellent at building and maintaining strong, positive working relationshipsRequired Skills/Abilities• Excellent verbal and written communication that is clear, well organized and demonstrates an understanding of audience needs• Ability to work independently and as part of a team• Strong supervisory and leadership skills• Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills• Excellent project planning skills with ability to work on several projects simultaneously• Extensive knowledge of the principles, procedures, and best practices in the dental industry• Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related softwareEducation and Experience:• MBA preferred, or Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, or other healthcare-related field required• At least 10 years of healthcare-related experience including 5 years in upper management/relevant leadership role requiredPhysical Requirements:Requires the ability to sit at a computer for hours at a time, and travel to and work in dental office locations.

column6: Job DescriptionThe Assistant Program Director is responsible for the coordination of all admissions into the program. They are responsible for documentation training and all documentation chart reviews. They should work directly with the MM to ensure all charts are up to date each day and all documentation is complete. Counseling reviews are forwarded to the Human Resource Manager.When indicated facilitates disciplinary actions in collaboration with the Administrator/Director, the Operations Department and if indicated the Human Resource Manager.Works with the Administrator/Director to arrange staff coverage to meet the needs of the program.This is a full-time position working Mon-Fri or Tues-Sat 8:30-6pmFor a virtual tour of the facility, please visit our website at (url removed).

What is EthSign?Built on Arweave, EthSign Next is our major pivot into the world outside EVM-compatible blockchains. It allows not only users from different blockchain systems, but really anyone who possesses a cryptographic keypair to digitally sign, encrypt, and permanently store documents and independently verify their validity. The user interface has received another facelift and numerous quality-of-life features have been added based on feedback from EthSign 4. Now, Alice from Bitcoin can seamlessly sign documents with Bob from Ethereum, Caine from TON, and Sam from Solana. There are no more smart contracts to interact with and since storage on Arweave is so cheap, we are covering all fees.This positionWe are looking for experienced visual designers to build a new branding set for the project. Visual designers are expected to improve design usability and aesthetic appeal with graphics, typography, layout, and color system. ResponsibilityBranding and Identity:Develop and implement a cohesive and visually appealing branding system that aligns with EthSign's values and objectives.Create and maintain brand guidelines to ensure consistency across all touchpoints.Graphic Design:Design engaging and impactful graphics for a variety of applications, including marketing materials, website assets, social media content, and more.Collaborate with marketing and other teams to translate concepts into visually stunning designs.3D Modeling:Produce high-quality 3D models that enhance our visual storytelling and elevate the overall brand experience.Implement 3D elements into various projects, including presentations, product visuals, and promotional materials.Simple Animations:Create simple yet effective animations to enhance the user experience on digital platforms.Integrate animations into marketing videos, presentations, and other multimedia content.Collaboration:Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and contribute creative ideas.Collaborate with external vendors and partners to ensure consistency in branding across all channels.

Job OverviewSocial Benefit is seeking a Senior Customer Success Manager to join our team. This individual will report to the Head of Customer Experience and play a pivotal role in ensuring that Navigator users are able to take full advantage of the tool’s capabilities to navigate government benefits and tax credits so they can maximize economic mobility for their clients or themselves. Responsibilities:● Serve as the voice of Case Worker and Agency customers, representing their needs and priorities to the entire Social Benefit team and influencing the end-to-end customer experience. ● Develop and lead the Account Management function. This includes managing implementation and day-to-day operations with our customers and partnering with the Navigator’s co-founders and Head of Customer Experience to proactively identify and resolve customer-specific issues. ● Develop and lead the Training and Support function to meet the needs of our customers, case managers, and clients/individuals. This includes hiring and growing the team responsible for training and support resources for the Navigator product, benefits and tax credits, and how to most effectively help people navigate this landscape. ● Lead and facilitate Group Trainings in person and on Zoom for new and current customers.● Manage 1:1 assisted support staff, operations, and associated tools and technology (ZenDesk).● Provide input to product roadmap based on partner and user feedback and your knowledge and experience.● Partner with leadership team on customer/user communications strategy. Deliver communications based on this strategy.● Support operational processes to keep Navigator customers and users confident and current on benefit and tax credit policies and ensure that the product, training, and customer resources are accurate. ● Regularly assess and report on performance against established KPIs.● Partner with leadership team to identify hiring needs and build the team that will grow with the business.● Guide the work described above from startup mode to scalable models. ● Contribute to strategic decision-making processes and actively participate in the overall vision and growth of the company.  Qualifications:● 7+ years’ experience in case management, including managing case managers.● Deep knowledge of the Los Angeles County benefit systems and key entities within this system.● Demonstrated ability to transfer experience and knowledge into sustainable programs and resources.● Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams within and across organizations.● Learning mindset and comfortable moving between hands-on execution and planning / building for scale, with the judgment to balance immediate and long-term needs.

column2: Senior Equity Analyst - Multi-Billion Long/Short Hedge Fund
column6: A rare opportunity to join one of the world's most successful hedge funds has arisen to join their highly regarded equities team as a Senior Equity Analyst. The prestigious business has a long positive track record and every year goes from strength to strength. The fund's Equity business is their core offering and continues to outperform the market. The firm is looking to hire a Senior Analyst to work in their New York office, supporting a successful Portfolio Manager on a +$3bn AUM portfolio. They harness technology better than almost all of their competitors and operate more like a fintech firm than a traditional hedge fund, reflected both through their investment strategy and their company culture.The candidate will have either buy-side Long/Short of Long-Only experience.

column2: Chief Operating Officer – High Growth Facility Services Roll-Up – Private Equity, 78801
column6: Chief Operating Officer – High Growth Facility Services Roll-Up – Private Equity Our client is a growing middle market facility services business primarily serving commercial customers. They are seeking an experienced Chief Operating Officer to lead an aggressive growth strategy under the direction of new private equity owners. This position will oversee a dispersed workforce that is rapidly expanding to serve a national customer base. The business serves customers through a network of field service branch locations and is looking for an executive leader with an owner mentality to build a highly effective team while professionalizing operations as the business continues to scale. We are seeking an experienced and driven Chief Operating Officer with a demonstrated ability to execute and lead the build out of an entrepreneurial facility services business in partnership with investors. You will have a successful track record of creating a culture of performance and operational excellence while managing a dispersed team that have come in through acquisitions. Ideally the COO will have experience in managing an aggressive growth strategy through M&A. The ideal candidate may have come out of HVAC, mechanical, electrical, fire life and safety, plumbing or other industrial services. About Cinereach Cinereach is a not-for-profit media incubator dedicated to the creation of entertaining new narratives that advance the values of justice and sustainability in popular media. Cinereach is producing new, engaging content designed to spark meaningful change at scale and pioneering new ways of story-making through research that combines artistic vision with social science and informed perspectives, empowering great storytellers to achieve even greater impact. Founded in 2006 as a film foundation and production company, Cinereach has produced numerous films including the Academy Award-nominated “Beasts of the Southern Wild” and “Marcel the Shell with Shoes On”, and supported over 200 others. Learn more at Cinereach.org.About the Role As the Manager, Learning & Design, you will be responsible for co-facilitating various programs and initiatives at Cinereach. You will split your time equally between research-focused tasks and project management. Reporting to the Director of Learning & Design, you will collaborate with community leaders, content creators, and influencers in the media industry. Your role will involve driving the success of initiatives by managing systems-facing project tasks and communication, supporting ideation and research processes, and coordinating incubation and research efforts. Research Responsibilities (50% of time): Conduct qualitative research and analysis on emergent trends, organizational climate, social and racial justice, and interconnected systems for projects. Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in learning and development. Contribute to coordinating and executing research efforts within the organization. Support the ideation process for the production of impactful media content. Provide insights and recommendations based on research findings to improve workshop design. Project Management Responsibilities (50% of time):Managing aspects of the implementation and delivery of Workshops, including scheduling, logistics, and resource coordination.Design and develop engaging Workshop and meeting materials, and multimedia presentations. Evaluate the effectiveness of Workshop processes through assessments, surveys, and feedback mechanisms. Supporting outreach and managing relationships with Workshop participants to ensure their contributions align with program objectives. Produce regular reports and presentations on program progress and outcomes.Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Education, Training and Development, Psychology, or a related field (or equivalent professional experience). Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Proficiency in database management and program reporting. Experience as a Program Manager or similar role in learning and development. Excellent organizational and communication skills, both written and verbal. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on continuous improvement. Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships. Demonstrated ability to work independently and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Passion for employee development and fostering a culture of continuous learning. Knowledge of research methodologies and analysis is a plus. Background in community work, government, education, OTT media, or civic organizations is a plus. By fulfilling the responsibilities of this role, you will contribute to the success of Cinereach's community programs, facilitate impactful learning experiences, and ensure the efficient operation of infrastructure. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Salary$66,000 to $88,000 annually, commensurate with geography, qualifications and experience. Hiring PracticesWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.This is a fully remote opportunity with occasional in-person events. At this time, we can only consider applicants with authorization to work in the United States on a permanent, full-time basis. Unfortunately, we cannot provide visa sponsorship.To ApplyPlease submit your resume to jobs@cinereach.org with subject line: "Manager, Learning & Design."

Murad Skincare has a 30-year legacy of developing clinically proven products that are backed by science and cruelty-free. Founded by dermatologist Dr. Howard Murad, we follow four pillars of wellness to create products and experiences for happier lives: Eat your water, be kind to your mind, nourish your skin, and awaken your body. We’re proud to be part of the Unilever prestige family that works every day towards enhancing sustainability and inclusivity. We stand against discrimination and hate, and actively advocate for inclusion: so much so that one of our core values is respect, connect, and appreciate. Our team members are as diverse as they are talented—each bringing a unique perspective to an environment that encourages coloring outside of the lines, speaking up, and collaboration—and we’re ready for you to join our team!The International Marketing Coordinator will support the international team and be responsible for the following areas that contribute to the overall growth of the brand.ResponsibilitiesAid in adapting marketing materials and campaigns for international audiences, ensuring alignment with brand guidelines.Help implement core business, global product launches, and activation materials internationally through their appropriate distribution channelWork cross-functionally with internal departments to support all international needs, with a high emphasis on working with the internal marketing teams to ensure a consistent global message is created and adapted internationallyMaintains accurate records of international data including, but not limited to, distributor information, door list, assortments, pricing, sales, and activity reportsAssist the International Marketing Manager with the execution of the yearly Marketing CalendarsPartnering with International Marketing Manager, you will help plan events such as the Yearly Distributor Business Conference and all other global and local eventsOwn and manage all international asset management programs, disseminating and adding information where neededSupport the International Marketing Manager with planning, executing, and dissemination the quarterly webinar, newsletter, and any distributor communicationManage assembly and shipment of Quarterly Marketing boxes to Distributor PartnersAssist with Forecast Decks & Product Launch Decks for new innovations, holidays, and promo– Compile all activation material provided for a product launch or campaign and communicate to all Distributor PartnersCoordinate creative requests and briefs for International Marketing initiatives and from International Distributor PartnersWork with the International Ops team to support distributor requests for marketing samplesSupport internal team members as well as distributors with visits and travel arrangements.Conduct basic research with international partners to identify opportunities, understand consumer behavior, and analyze competitor activities in target regions.Requirements/QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field. Relevant internships or coursework in international marketing is a plus.Must be an excellent team player who can build, foster, and nurture relationships with members of the global marketing team and cross-functional teams.Must be highly organized and detail-oriented, with a strong ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously with un-prompted follow-through.Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)Enthusiasm for international and cultural diversity, with a willingness to adapt and learn from different market contexts.Creative thinker, self-starterKnowledge of global beauty and luxury goods marketsGood communication skills, both written and verbal, in English. Additional language proficiency in other languages is a plusWhat We OfferUnlimited Paid Time OffMedical, Dental, and Vision Insurance. FSA/HSALife/Accident InsuranceEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Professional Development Resources401(k) Employer Match ProgramThis position is based in our El Segundo, CA headquarters, which is currently 40% hybrid onsite/remote work. The expected base salary for this position is $65,000 to $75,000. The exact base salary is determined by various factors including experience, skills, education, geographic location, and budget. This position is designed for individuals who are passionate about marketing and eager to gain hands-on experience in international marketing coordination. It offers opportunities for learning and growth within a supportive team environment.Murad is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Murad is an equal opportunity employer; committed to creating a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Why Choose Jefferson Health Plans?We are an award-winning, not-for-profit health maintenance organization. We are committed to creating a community where everyone belongs, acknowledges, and celebrates diversity and has opportunities to grow to their fullest potential.We offer Medicaid, Medicare, and Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP) plans that include special benefits to improve the health and wellness of our members. We’re also committed to boosting the health of our community through outreach, education, and events. Founded over 35 years ago, Jefferson Health Plans continually develops new ways to encourage better health outcomes and has received national recognition for our innovations in managed care.While this job currently provides a flexible remote option, due to in-office meetings, training as required, or other business needs, our employees are to be residents of PA or the nearby states of DE or NJ.Perks of JHP and why you will love it here:Competitive Compensation Packages including 401(k) Savings Plan with Company Match and Profit Sharing Flextime and Work-at-Home OptionsBenefits & Wellness Program including generous Time Off Impact on the communities we service We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic Healthcare Data Analyst to join our team!The Healthcare Economics (HCE) team’s primary function is to provide various clinical and financial analyses to management to support the business decision process. In addition, the team will provide consistent, accurate reporting to help management from other departments do their jobs more effectively.The Healthcare Data Analyst will be responsible for compiling, verifying, and analyzing data for trend and other analyses related to clinical, provider, and senior management requirements. This person will also be involved in defining and verifying consistent, reliable datasets for use by all Jefferson Health Plans departments. They will gain exposure to a broad range of financial, clinical and analytical issues.As the Healthcare Data Analyst, your daily duties may include:Create accurate and meaningful reports for departmental and management decision-making using Qlik, MicroStrategy, MS Access, MS Excel, healthcare business intelligence tools and other reporting tools as necessary. Provide utilization and outcome analysis, trend and other reports involving authorizations, claims, and membership data. Analyze data in order to uncover underlying utilization patterns and identify clinical and medical delivery drivers of trends. Examples of data analyses include, but are not limited to: identifying and tracking members for disease and case management, incentive and rewards programs, monitoring and evaluation of performance-based contracting, analysis of demographic mix, benefit changes, fee schedule updates, medical trends and marketing evaluation of expansion opportunities.Analyze data for quality improvement studies and analysis (quantitative and qualitative) including trending, statistical analysis, and complex drill down of data to evaluate root causes.Maintain and automate reports to support productivity and return on investment programs.Verify and analyze report data and prepare documentation of processes needed for development and improvement of applications. Help implement improved applications and processes, where appropriate.Prepare, verify and maintain dashboards, which contain frequently requested data and reports, that are professional looking, clear and user-friendly.Analyze data for anomalies and assist with checking data integrity.Serve as a technical resource to management and staff in developing specific questions to be analyzed while determining the appropriate analysis methodology, performing analysis and strategy development.Effectively communicate results of analysis to the intended audience: staff, management, senior-level, and/or executive.Research issues to determine source of discrepancies.Manage, navigate and mine data from current and future systems and develop streamlined, simplified and reliable information to improve business decisions.Develop executive level reports summarizing the financial impacts of quality improvement and cost savings initiatives and revenue projections.Develop a working knowledge of the DHS/CMS Risk Adjustment process, HEDIS, NCQA Accreditation, and CMS Stars Program.Work with other departments to serve as a subject-matter-expert for claims, membership, utilization, and clinical data.Prepare reports for owner and provider groups and share the reports directly with provider representatives. Explain the reports and help them develop initiatives to improve member health, improve member satisfaction and reduce medical costs.Analyze providers, both PCP’s and specialists, on the basis of efficiency and effectiveness and develop meaningful reports to help them find areas for improvement.Support company-wide initiatives to improve processes and streamline and integrate systems to improve data consistency and integrity.Peer review work of other HCE associates, as requested.Must abide to the Mission Statement of Jefferson Health Plans in all interactions and activities.Qualifications B.S. or higher degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics or other analytical field of study. 2 or more years of clinical/healthcare experience with emphasis on utilization review, case management, managed care, data analysis and/or quality assurance. Experience with provider coding practices using CPT, ICD-10 diagnosis codes, and DRG’s a plus. Understanding of delivery and reimbursement of medical services in a managed care environment. Familiarity with the role disease management, utilization management and care management play in a managed care organization. Skills, We Value: Strong problem-solving, quantitative and analytical skills. Ability to use business intelligence query tools, computer spreadsheet (Excel), and database languages (Access and others at advanced level).Working knowledge of SQL. Knowledge of Medicare Insurance and policies preferred.Proven skills in report writing and report development. Dashboard development skills a plus. Proven skills with data presentation including charts, graphs and other exhibits. Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. Ability to explain technical terms to non-technical people and to explain business situations to technical teams.Ability to handle multiple responsibilities and changing priorities. Ability to quickly learn and implement knowledge of new technical processes. Must pay attention to details. Excellent organizational skills.

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Digital Designer/Creative Director to drive the creative vision for the brand with visually engaging and high-end digital content for our digital marketing initiatives and DTC business. As a key member of our growing team, you will report to the Director of DTC and Digital Marketing and will have a direct impact on the growth and success of Qunol. You must be comfortable remaining hands-on when it comes to concepting, obsessed with execution and a deep understanding of design, while also be able to direct and lead the creative function to support the strategic goals of the organization and its brands and you will work at the intersection of brand, UX and performance marketing team. Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, copywriters, and photographers, to ensure cohesive and impactful digital campaigns. Own and lead the UX design, strategy, and execution for Qunol.com with a key focus on revamping the designs to deliver outsized improvements with the brand's aesthetic, is user-friendly, and optimized for conversions.Possess and master the latest design trends, digital marketing best practices, and emerging digital/creative technologies available. Qualifications:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each duty mentioned satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Minimum of 7+ years of working experience as a graphic designer in a digital and ecommerce environment that focuses on CPGMastery of Adobe CS5+ Photoshop, Illustrator, and In Design required; basic Microsoft Office application knowledgeExtreme attention to detail, including top-notch organizing and multitasking skills to meet tight deadlines, handle multiple projects and prioritize accordinglyA strong portfolio showcasing brand experience across digital surfacesBottom funnel Video production ability will be preferred.The ability to work independently to explore concepts from beginning to end, while seeking healthy feedback loops with your ideasSolid knowledge of web design principlesAbility to safeguard brand style guidesShopify experience would be niceStrong executor who is comfortable being entrepreneurialThrives in a fast-paced business environment with an ability to adapt quickly to changeBachelor’s degree in graphic design, Digital Media, or related field (or equivalent work experience). What We Are Looking For:Entrepreneurial and self-starter: Can identify issues as they occur and can take the initiative to address them A results-oriented person with a strong work ethic and foundation in organizing, planning, and prioritizing tasks· Creative & outside in thinking- Able to identify macro creative trends, make recommendations and implementAn individual who stays up to date with evolving tech, e-commerce and digital trendsStrong organizational and time management/ project management skillsFlexibility, adaptability and the ability to work in a fast-paced work environmentBenefits:  We offer a competitive base salary and a comprehensive benefits package with a choice of health plans that includes medical, dental, vision, a 401(k) investment package along with paid time off.  Our company is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.

COMPANY OVERVIEWRare Beauty, based in El Segundo, aims to break down unrealistic standards of perfection. Here at Rare Beauty, we place purpose and social impact at the heart of everything we do—from the products we make, to the community we create. We empower our team and our community to challenge beauty norms by shaping positive conversations about self-acceptance and mental health. We promote self-acceptance and give people the tools they need to feel less alone in the world. Our mission is to help everyone celebrate their individuality by redefining what beautiful means. We take pride in offering best-in-class benefits, with medical monthly premiums covered by the Company at 100%, employee certification in mental health first aid at work, regular wellness activities, quarterly makeup stipend, and much more!POSITION SUMMARYOur ideal Retail Operations Coordinator is highly organized, able to prioritize and enjoys a fast-paced work environment in the beauty industry. As the backbone of our Retail Team, you’ll be providing critical administrative support. This role will report directly to the Global Retail Marketing Manager.RESPONSIBILITIESResponsible for maintaining and updating relevant retail documents as directed by Retail leadership team: Global Retail Marketing Calendar, BA sales trackers, retailer site audits, inventory and pricing audits, and folders for global social and ecomm exposures.Collaborate with Retail, Product Development and Operations teams to update retailer setup forms for domestic and international accounts. Responsible for ensuring all SKU creation, product page marketing documents and sampling forms are accurate and shared with retailers in a timely manner. Support the team with administrative tasks such as retailer setup forms, internal order forms, and PO creation in NetSuite. Work closely with Purchasing and Operations teams to ensure product comps are ordered and shared with retailers in timely manner; this includes order and label creation, as well as tracking of shipments and troubleshooting of potential shipment challenges. Responsible for managing office product closet. This includes working with the Operations team to order products, working with internal teams to ensure the tracker is being updated, and working with office management to handle delivery logistics. Support Retail and Education team with gratis programs and event logistics. This includes ordering product, monkey survey creation, managing day of logistics, working with outside vendors, label creation, and tracking shipments/troubleshooting potential shipment challenges. Collaborate with internal teams and use out-of-the-box thinking and trend research to contribute to team meetings and brainstorming sessions. Monitor and report competitive brands, activities, and products by identifying and evaluating product characteristics, market trends and share, pricing, and advertising – across the categories of skincare, color cosmetics, bath & body, and haircare.Develop and maintain excellent relationships with all customer partners, vendors, and internal Rare Beauty team members. Support Retail team leadership by organizing travel accommodations when relevant. Other duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree preferred with specialization in business administration, marketing, or related fieldProficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and OutlookExperience working with beauty retailers is a plus (particularly with Sephora)Experience working with international partners (Europe, Middle East, Asia, Oceania) is a plusStrong attention to detail with excellent communication skillsAble to multi-task in a fast-paced environmentTeam player that works well with othersAbility to think ahead and anticipate opportunities and challengesCreative and resourceful problem solverSelf-motivated and proactive approach with an appropriate sense of urgencyCandidate must have an awareness of cultural differences in the workplace and be able to communicate appropriately with global partners of diverse culturesCandidates MUST be punctual, professional, positive, polished, and passionate about beauty!PHYSICAL DEMANDSFrequently moves product weighing up to 30 pounds across office for various needsFrequently moves about inside the office to access storage rooms, office machinery, etcMust be able to see product/inventory for packaging/shippingProlonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computerDomestic travel may be required

Job Title: Healthcare Recruiter Location: 100% remote (must be located in New Jersey) Schedule: Full time 8:30-9 or 9-5:30 EST Duration/Type: Contract w/ potential for permanent placement Job Overview:LHH Recruitment Solutions has partnered with a healthcare organization seeking a Healthcare Recruiter. This position is 100% remote, but you must be based in New Jersey. This recruiter is responsible for sourcing, selection, and hiring processes for physician practices and ambulatory care centers. This is a temporary position with the potential for long-term employment based on performance.Responsibilities:Recruits for vacant positions. Establishes and maintains effective partnering relationships with assigned departments to ensure they’re hiring, and retention goals and objectives are achieved.Establishes and maintains effective recruitment/retention programs and develops strategies to attract and retain qualified candidates.Recruits viable applicants for employment utilizing various methods including, but not limited to, advertising, employee referrals, job fairs and direct mailings.Maintains communication with candidates, interviews, extends offers, and assists in the completion of the on-boarding process. Ensures a professional and enjoyable candidate experience throughout the selection and interviewing process.Counsels employees regarding interdepartmental transfers, promotional opportunities and continuing education programs.Ensures follow up with employees for in-house retention and employee satisfaction.Maintains applicant tracking system and HR reporting as required.Assist with planning and execution of HR special events (i.e. Recruitment Events, Open Houses, Orientation, etc.).Provides external and internal customers with appropriate service levels. Meets with employees and serves as liaison to external departments as necessary and delivers consistently accurate, efficient, and professional service.Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree required. Graduate or undergraduate concentration in Human Resources, Business, Nursing or Behavioral Sciences.Master’s Degree preferred. Three to five years progressively responsible experience in Human Resources required.ATS system experience strongly preferred.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.Excellent time and work load management skill, ability to prioritize, ability to work independently, high attention to detail, and ability to multi-task and meeting established deadlines. Benefit offerings include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, additional voluntary benefits, EAP program, commuter benefits and a 401K plan. Our program provides employees with the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. Available paid leave may include Paid Sick Leave, where required by law; any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law; and Holiday pay upon meeting eligibility criteria.

DSJ Global is partnered with a leading food manufacturing organization that is rapidly expanding! The team is looking for a Global Director of Continuous Improvement (remote) to join their team.With this position, you will play a pivotal role in driving operational excellence initiatives across our food manufacturing facilities located in two countries. Your primary focus will be on Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) and Lean methodologies to optimize processes, enhance productivity, and ensure the highest quality standards are consistently met.Responsibilities of the OPEX Director Include: Develop and Implement Operational Excellence Strategies: Design and implement comprehensive operational excellence strategies aligned with business objectives, emphasizing TPM and Lean principles.Multi-Site Leadership: Provide leadership and direction to operational teams across multiple manufacturing sites located in different countries.TPM Implementation: Lead TPM initiatives to minimize equipment downtime, improve overall equipment effectiveness (OEE), and enhance asset utilization.Lean Manufacturing: Drive Lean manufacturing practices to streamline processes, eliminate waste, and optimize resource utilization across all production areas.Continuous Improvement: Champion a culture of continuous improvement by fostering innovation, identifying areas for optimization, and implementing solutions to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including production, engineering, quality assurance, and supply chain to ensure alignment and integration of operational excellence initiatives.Qualifications of the OPEX Director Include: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Operations Management, or a related field.Extensive experience (8+ years) in operational leadership roles within the food manufacturing industry.Proven track record of implementing TPM and Lean methodologies to drive operational improvements and achieve business objectives.Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate cross-functional teams.Certification in TPM, Lean Six Sigma, or related methodologies is a plus.able to travel up to 40%

column2: Uniform Bar Exam Essay Grader - Contract (REMOTE)
column6: Quimbee has a massive library of content designed to help law students and attorneys succeed, every step of the way. Not only do we help law students succeed in law school and on the bar exam, but Quimbee is also equally committed to building a premier collection of courses designed to satisfy attorneys' MCLE requirements. Quimbee can be accessed on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. We are seeking experienced bar exam graders to help our law students pass the bar!This position is 100% remote. All you need is an internet connection and a quiet place to work.OverviewWe are looking for exceptional attorneys and legal educators who are passionate about providing feedback to law students on bar exam essays. This is a position of great trust and responsibility.Who We're Looking ForYou're a really smart lawyer. This means you have a JD from an accredited law school. You excelled in law school and aced the bar thereafter. You're the kind of person law students will respect receiving feedback from, and you thoroughly enjoy providing it to them.You're an exceptional legal writer. Ideally, you served on a law journal (law review would be even better). If you got something published, then that's extra points. You understand that less is more, details matter, and small words are better than big words.You're a detail-oriented self-starter: You're disciplined and motivated and the kind of person who doesn't need someone looking over your shoulder to make sure you're doing your job.RequirementsMinimum:A JD from an accredited U.S. law schoolMust be a licensed attorney, in good standing, in any UBE jurisdictionMust be comfortable working in a collaborative and remote team environmentPreferred:2 years of experience in the active practice and/or teaching of lawPast bar exam essay grading experienceBenefits100% remote$35 per essay

JOB SUMMARYNABA, Inc. is seeking an enthusiastic, highly energetic, full-time individual who wants to use their talents and skills for the advancement of Black Business professionals. If you are a motivated self-starter committed to social impact outcomes with a focus on professional development program(s), join our team. NABA, Inc. is a nonprofit membership association dedicated to bridging the opportunity gap for Black Business Leaders in accounting, finance business, and entrepreneurship. Representing more than 200,000 Black Business Leaders in these fields, NABA advances people, careers, and the mission by providing education, resources, and meaningful careerconnections to professional and student members.JOB DESCRIPTIONESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:The primary work of the Manager is working with the Associate Director to support the CEO in ensuring effectiveness and efficiency in her schedule and follow through in the work. In collaboration with the Associate Director, they will partner with the CEO to set up systems and support to run effectively and move the work forward.To be successful in this role, you will bring a strategic mind and collaborative approach to leadership, enjoying the challenge of constantly and consistently improving operational efficiency and performance in a fast-paced environment. In addition, you will be skilled at anticipating the needs of others and proactively taking on new challenges to support business and people's needs. Ideally, you bring strong business and financial management experience with a focused, thoughtful approach to strategy and planning.GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:Project Management (60 %):• Lead and facilitate processes and systems to implement projects and programs on behalf of NABA• Structure planning, implementation, and post-implementation processes and systems on behalf of key NABA projects• Ensure great communication between all stakeholders in project planning and implementation• Contribute to the growing body of knowledge of projects and programs to improve our work and enhance our missionTeam Collaboration and Communication (20%):• Create efficient, timely systems of communications and support, from executive updates to staff briefings that ensure that essential information is shared. Create models of these programs and execute them in the highest priority projects.• Serve as a resource for communications systems for teammates• Ensure a culture of excellence by creating and executing practices that empower staff, enable speed and flexibility, and maintain the highest quality of service with operations• Advise leadership and develop strategies for leading and managing change, inclusive of strategies for change communication, resistance, risk mitigation, coaching, and trainingOperational Systems (20%):• Lead the development and standardization of day-to-day operational systems, participating in both executive-level and detail-level decision-making on the full range of market activities• Build and nurture critical relationships with key stakeholders that support capacity building, growth, and operational efficiency• As a member of the leadership team, make decisions to ensure the most efficient utilization of resources• Oversee development and implementation of facilities plan to manage and operate facilities• Embrace and take on ad hoc issues related to operationsREQUIRED JOB QUALIFICATIONSEducation and Experience Requirement(s):• 3 –5 years of experience in Executive support and operations• Excellent flexibility and adaptability with a strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit to accommodate significant responsibilities and shifting priorities• Superior organizational skills and attention to detail• Strong executive presence• Exceptional oral and written communication skills• Ability to make firm strategic decisions in a dynamic and fast-paced environment• Strong time management skills and the ability to thrive under pressure• Proficiency in Microsoft Office with strong PowerPoint and Excel skills• A passion for working with people, an unshakable belief in their potential, and a strong commitment to the mission of NABA, IncKnowledge, Skills, and Abilities:• Must possess strong leadership qualities• Must have strong organizational, analytical, and coordinating abilities• Ability to work as part of a team• Excellent problem-solving abilities• Must be creative and able to prioritize tasks in the face of many challenges• Ability to supervise and work in a team environment (as needed)• Ability to work independently and work under deadlines• Proven stakeholder management skills• Commitment to organizational mission and valuesCompetencies:• Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands, changes approaches or methods to best fit the situation, able to deal with frequent changes, delays, or unexpected events.• Planning/Organization - Priorities and plans work activities, uses time efficiently, develops realistic action plans• Quality Management - Looks for ways to improve and promote quality, demonstrates accuracy and thoughtfulness• Initiative - takes initiative in appropriate situations and goes beyond expectations when necessary.• Relationships - develops relationships based upon trust, respect, and commitment to NABA’s mission• Understanding organizational values/Culture alignment - Tactfully approaches others, reacts well under pressure, treats others with respect and consideration, accepts responsibility for own actions, and follows through on commitments.Physical Requirements:• Ability to communicate and exchange information as well as use a computer.• Office/Remote working environment• Ability to transport up to 20 lbs.• DMV residence preferred but not mandatoryDIVERSITY STATEMENT:As an equal-opportunity employer, NABA is committed to a diverse, multicultural work environment. NABA does not discriminate in employment based on age, race, creed, gender, religion, marital status, veteran’s status, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, and/or other protected status as required by applicable law.ORGANIZATION BACKGROUND:The mission of NABA is to address the professional needs of its members and to build leaders that shape the future of the accounting and finance profession with an unfaltering commitment to inspire the same in their successors.NABA’s vision is for unlimited opportunities and growth for Black business leaders in accounting and related business professions. Learn more about NABA's vision at www.nabainc.org/vision.BENEFITS:This position offers a competitive compensation package, including full medical and dental benefits; disability insurance; life insurance; and retirement fund options.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Product Planning: Work closely with buyers to develop product plans based on category performance targets and sales forecasting.Report Generation: Regularly produce merchandise reports on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis, ensuring a well-rounded perspective by merging insights on sales patterns, procurement initiatives, inventory trends, Gross Profit Trends, and consumer behavior. Inventory Oversight: Execute stringent protocols to detect and rectify inventory anomalies. Tracking of product lifecycle to optimize inventory.Cross-functional Collaboration: Maintain robust communication lines with departments like HQ, warehouse, operations, logistics, finance, and marketing.System Expertise: Develop in-depth expertise in primary enterprise systems, such as OA, SAP, and POS.Store Visits: Conduct regular store visits for on-ground assessments, ensuring alignment between product plans and store operations.Performance Metrics Adherence: Drive continuous improvement by focusing on pivotal Merchandise KPIs, emphasizing metrics like turnover, SKU diversity, and PM results.Other Duties: Engage in any other pertinent tasks and projects as needed.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in data science, Business Analytics, Statistics, computer, mathematics or a related field. Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience in data analysis, preferably within a retail or e-commerce context. Mastery over data visualization tools, such as Power BI, Python, and Excel. Proficiency in the MS Office Suite is mandatory.Exceptional analytical thinking complemented by a results-driven approach.Superior communication skills, both written and verbal, with a knack for synthesizing complex data into digestible insights.Innate adaptability and resilience, especially when navigating high-pressure, dynamic scenarios.A rigorous attention to detail, paired with strategic foresight.

Job DescriptionPosition Summary:The primary duties of this role are to develop tactical and strategic pricing for use in quote and bid preparation in response to customer’s RFQ. You will utilize existing pricing models, historical pricing data and cost estimating tools. You will also perform pricing analysis and present recommendations to sales team management. The successful candidate will prepare and deliver RFQ and Quote metrics in daily review meeting and use this data to drive process improvements.Primary Duties & ResponsibilitiesReceive, review, and process all Requests for Quote (RFQ) from approved customers within 48 hours. Exceptions to this turnaround time metric are for new configurations, new part numbers and large or complex bids.Communicate with customers on any issue or question related to their RFQs.Review customer requests to negotiate pricing and provide recommendations to Account Managers.Work with Account Managers to identify and develop new opportunities.Work with the Customer Service team to respond to customer requests within 48 hours.Maintain the highest ethical standards.Ensure pricing is aligned with market conditions while maintaining our margin targets.Update quote metrics with all incoming and outgoing quotes.Develop and maintain a strong working relationship with key customers – internal and external.Coordinate with Engineering to review customer drawings as needed to ensure characteristics and technical requirements conform to our product designs.Review costs with Purchasing and Engineering groups to ensure correct cost are used in pricing calculations.Review specifications including technical drawings and bills of material to calculate production costs using labor and material pricing schedules and historical data.Other duties as assigned.Experience & EducationRequired Experience:Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in business, engineering, mathematics or related fieldMinimum of 7 years of experience pricing and quoting in a manufacturing environment in lieu of education requirement.Must have knowledge, experience and competence in the concepts and standard practices of pricing, quoting and related costing and in a manufacturing business.Must have experience in price negotiation and working with contracts.Preferred ExperienceExperience in the Aerospace industry is strongly preferred.Experience reading and interpreting manufacturing drawings, specifications and other technical documents is strongly preferred.Required SkillsExcellent analytical skills and attention to detail to analyze and solve a variety of moderately complex pricing and cost problems.Critical thinking skills with the ability to identify market intelligence and or patterns in RFQ’sStrong bias for action with a curious and investigative nature to understand our markets and pricing at a strategic level.Advanced Excel skillsIntermediate skills with MS Word, PowerPoint and OutlookMust have extensive experience preparing quotes in an ERP systemMust have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and writtenMust possess exceptional time management skills, be highly organized and have the proven ability to prioritize and manage multiple pricing projects and deliver on time.Must be able to work extended hours when required.Experience with report writing and presentation preparation is a plus.JD Edwards and / or Syteline ERP system experience is a plus.
